text:
First off the customer service in this place is great.
I walked in to the mac shack wanting and hoping for a warm, cheesy, goodness that would be the next new level in my mac and cheese arsenal.
so I ordered the "smoke house" mac and cheese, which by the description from the menu sounded ridiculous. I was pumped, I thought to my self man this is going to be epic!!!
also got the garlic bread (because I love some good garlic bread) 
so I sat down in there very well done restaurant area
Then a short time after I got the soup...I mean mac ... well it could have passed for soup. looking at it stomach rumbling I take a bite, instantly an overwhelming taste of very sweet bbq sauce hit my taste buds and not a hint of the smoked gouda as promised from the menu. 
The dish resembled vodka sauce and mac elbows, no cheese and so much soupy sauce that I could soke it up with the garlic butter covered little Cesar's style bread sticks.
after about 6 bites I gave up and abandoned the dish.
I do really wish that I would have had a better experience at this fast casual restaurant. maybe the cook needs to be retrained or replaced either way they wont getting any $13 lunches from me. 
to me first impressions are everything and should be. this places food did not impress me in the slightest.

I ordered a chicken Alfredo with mushrooms. It was okay. Compared to the other location on Warm Springs and Durango, this one seemed stingy with their ingredients. I also upgraded it to the mangia and it barely had chicken and mushroom. Not a fan of Mac Shack's chicken in general, something about it is off, maybe a little too dry for me. The flavor wasn't as strong as I'd like it to be, maybe the penne was too thick, I don't know. They are pretty fast with service and friendly so this is the place to go for something quick and mediocre. Their garlic bread is free when you check in thank goodness because it's definitely not worth $2. Probably will give them another shot, but not any time soon.
Had the cheddar Mac and the Philly cheesesteak Mac.  Food was fantastic!  Loved the atmosphere.  Will be coming back!!

Some people recommended this place to my mother & I... and I guess it's good for some people, but not for us!  The garlic breadsticks were awful... the only flavor they had was heavy garlic, that I was belching up hours later, even after only 2 bites.  It wasn't smooth & yummy like most garlic bread I've had almost anywhere else.
As for the pasta... I had penne alfredo and my mom had the angel hair marinara... I admit, I'm picky, and I literally ate 2 bites and couldn't eat any more... first, the pasta was chewy & crunchy... maybe al dente, not my choice for pasta... or just not cooked properly, IDK... but worse was the alfredo sauce... it was SO heavy on the butter & cheese... mostly butter, that's really all I could taste, but worst of all was the bitter after-taste that came a few seconds later.  Awful.  And mom's marinara was worse, it was too acidic & bitter, she actually spit hers out into her napkin and couldn't eat more than that first bite, and she said the after-taste was even worse... she tried mine as well, and said mine was a TINY bit better.
So I guess some people like the taste of their sauces. But sadly for us, it was awful and a waste of $20... we walked out leaving 2 full bowls of pasta, and one full order of breadsticks, and a second order of breadsticks with a couple bites out of them... waste of money and time, very disappointing overall.  Definitely not for us & not somewhere I'd go again.

I think their lunch deal is good for something cheap and quick,  otherwise this place is just alright for me.  Seems everything I've ordered is over salted. They say their salads come with vinaigrette dressing but I never have dressing on my salad- unless you consider a bunch of salt dressing.? Soup too salty, pasta too salty, salads salty.  Place is clean staff is nothing special in the friendliness department.

Several days ago, I decided to try Mac Shack for the first time. I had received several ads in the mail for this restaurant and decided to give it a shot. I ordered online and chose 'pick-up' rather than delivery. I was asked to provide my credit card info and told that my card would not be charged online and that I just needed to bring this credit card with me to the restaurant, to pick my order up. I've done this before, with several other restaurants and never been charged on the website before....unless I requested a 'delivery'. This is the FIRST restaurant to not only charge me on their website but also in the restaurant, when I went to pick up my order. They charged me TWICE for the same order. Are you kidding me?? I had to file a claim with my bank for the 2nd charge and fortunately for me, my bank is awesome and they were able to close the claim in my favor and refund my money right away. I won't be going back to this restaurant, ever. This was my first time going and it was a nightmare. The food wasn't that great (way too much oil in all their dishes) and I can't stand dishonesty. I won't let this restaurant try to scam me twice. Beware!

I did a search for vegan food on Yelp and the Mac Shack came up.  Last weekend I went to eat there and asked the cashier if there were vegan items on the menu.  The cashier did not seem to know what vegan means, so she asked the girl working next to her.  The second girl said they do not serve any vegan items.  The way the second girl replied to her co-worker left me wondering if there really were not any vegan items on the menu, or if she just did not want to be bothered telling me what items were vegan.  The place wasn't very busy when I was there, so it wasn't like she couldn't find the time.  Although a few menu items looked as if they could be vegan, rather than trying to ask, we just left.

It looks like a nice place, but for us, the customer service was lacking.  If there are vegan items on the menu, I hope someone will point them out.  There are no designations, as far as I could see, on the website menu.

A failed attempt at a more chic version of Noodles & Company. Dishes were decent but cheese was mostly bland and tasteless. Philly Cheesesteak Mac and Wisconsin Mac were both bland despite having ample cheese. 'Garlic Bread' was dried out breadsticks brushed with garlic butter. Tomato soup was tasty,  but not worth a trip by itself.
Have to say I was excited to try this place. But I was deeply disappointed. I got the truffle baked mac and it had similar taste to a stouffers frozen Mac and cheese for 4 times the price.
I went again to Mac Shack last night (the Warm Springs location) and had the Alfredo pasta again! So so so good! Also, I saw the cutest boy named Calvin wiping the tables! (:
My favorite pasta spot in vegas!! Cheap, quick and most importantly its delicious.

Decided to wait to write this review until our second trip to mac shack because the first left a little something to be desired. But after the second I've decided the real issue here is the systems. Our first trip resulted in one wrong order and our second in a wrong order and a cold soup. The food itself is very good. I had the taco Mac the first time and it was fantastic. On the second trip I tried the lunch special (available until 5) but I won't make that mistake again. The lunch special is essentially a make your own pasta with a soup and drink for about 50 cents more than the normal make your own deal. The catch is that any additional items (beyond sauce) are extra which really limits the possibilities. If you come to Mac shack and stick with the menu items and are lucky enough to get your order correctly you'll be made in the shade. I will say the staff was very nice through all of the mistakes. Thanks!

We went there for the first time on a Friday night. They have lots of specials and a great menu. You can choose dishes or create your own. We decided to make our own. The staff was VERY helpful and gave great advice. We ordered linguine with alfredo sauce, double shrimp, mozzarella, spinach, garlic, artichokes, asparagus and mushrooms and r
Then rigatoni with marinara, meatballs and mozzarella. Both dishes were cooked to perfection and all the ingredients were fresh. We also ordered salads. The spinach salad was one of the best that I have ever had and enough for a meal in itself. We ordered it to go and the care that was put into making sure it got home safely was truly appreciated.

It was a great meal, reasonably priced and the staff was amazing!!!! We highly recommend it and now have a favorite place to go.
Thanks to all the staff for making a great meal for us.

We have been here twice, and both times the food had been delicious. On this trip, my wife had the pomodoro fresco with a side of meatballs, and i had the crazy alfredo. The alfredo was spiced just right with large pieces of jalapeno mixed in with sausage, chicken, shrimp and sun dried tomatoes. Each dish will serve two people, but, if you're feeling decadent, you can always get to go boxes.

I've been here a handful of times, and each time I hope it'll be better. The food is mediocre at best. I ordered the crazy Alfredo and my pasta was literally swimming in oil. 
The most off putting thing about Mac Shack is their horrible customer service. Employees are not friendly or welcoming. We walked in the door and they were asking whether we were dining in or to go. No welcome, or suggestions about anything on the menu. Tonight we ordered to go since the atmosphere is so unwelcoming. While we were waiting one of the employees was rolling silverware and just tossing them. We ate our to go order outside and one of the tables had a bunch of dirty dishes that looked had been there for a while. 

I tried to give it another chance, but this will definitely be the last time I eat here.

Incredible lunch today at the new Mac Shack on west Charleston. Food was ridiculously good and the value and service was equally as impressive with kids eating free on Sunday and a ton of gluten free options. Curbside pick up too for takeout. Definitely one of our new fav spots.

Great food and great atmosphere. Had never been here before and now I want to go all the time. The grilled Mac and cheese is amazing. The service was awesome out cashier was very helpful. Everyone in the party tried something different and they were all great. I would definitely recommend Mac Shack to anyone who likes pasta!

Mac Shack is a decent fast service restaurant. I've been to this particular location quite a few times and have ordered a few different things. My favorite dish is the create your own pasta with wagon wheels, vodka sauce, ricotta, and spinach. That's what I ordered today. However I received the same thing minus the spinach plus red peppers. I unfortunately didn't get my receipt either so I didn't feel like saying anything. I just sat there and ate it instead. Luckily I like red peppers so it tasted fine. I love the Yelp check in for free breadsticks! Mac Shack is a cool concept but I probably won't be back for a while. My roommate was extremely disappointed with her meal for the third time now and the employees I've encountered aren't that friendly. If anything I would just order to go..but at that point I could always make pasta at home! I'll give it another go sometime in the future.

I ate here for lunch. I thought the macaroni was good and just needed a little salt and pepper. The sweet corn soup was amazing. It is a great place to go if you want some pasta. I like that you can make your own pasta dish using ingredients you choose.

Great concept. Can make your own pasta dish or you can have Mac and cheese. Great kids selection as well. Lunch special Monday through Saturday.  I had their Mac and cheese and added jalapeño and sausage. Was a little disappointed in the portion on the add on but the Mac and cheese dish was great size. Garlic bread was fantastic. My son is very picky and had fettuccini with meatball and tomato sauce. It is always hit or miss if he will like his food. He loved it. Plenty of seating inside and a coke machine that can create 100 different combos. 

Service was outstanding. Samantha greeted us when we walked in and was pleasant and patient as we ordered. Matt brought our food with a smile and checked back later to ensure everything was okay. He even bussed our table while we lingered. The owner walked us through the menu prior to ordering. Overall a great experience and the price was right. I would definitely come back.

I love this place. The music is old Sinatra. The food is amazing with endless possibilities. Fast service. Great people.
Muah, Mac Shack, Muah.

Although the food is good. They're continually unable to fulfill items on their menu!!! If you want a red velvet cupcake you have to place your order then go beg for someone to hold it for you and when that's not enough I assume a bribe of some sort is your next option. Please don't be surprised when the incompetent staff blames you for not having what's on the menu???!!!! Are you F. Serious!!!!!!!!!!! As customers when you paid 45 minutes ago for something and when you show up they don't have it, but since you placed your order online your stuck paying $4 p/item they don't have???!!! B.S.!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Go screw with your HORRIBLE SERVICE, NO PRODUCT AND AN ADDITTUDE THAT IT'S THE CUSTOMERS FAULT FOR NOT BEING ON TOP OF THE ORDER???!!! WHEN I GET PAID TO DO SO I WILL!! I GUARANTEE I CAN RUN CIRCLES AROUND ALL OF YOU COMBINED. #INCOMPTENCE #CRAP #DISSATISFIED #CLEANHOUSE #REALEMPLOYEES

It's been a very long time since coming here and I still love it. Ordered our food, got my drink at the drink fountain, and as I sat down the food already arrived. Service and food is excellent.  They came and cleared our table when we were done faster than good high end restaurants.
I've come here a couple times and the food is always delicious!! Very fast service, even when busy. The decor is really cute and bathrooms and tables are always clean. Will be returning regularly!

Great and affordable place for pasta and carb lovers. 

I've been here a couple of times since it's opened and the food and service has always been good. I love the open kitchen concept where you can see the cooks creating the dishes one by one. I've tried some of the favorite pasta bowls as well as the Create Your Own bowls and they are delicious for the most part. The pasta is not overcooked and they don't drown it in sauce, like some other places do. The only complaint I have is that they can be stingy on the amount of meat they put in.

Love this place. The taco Mac is great. Some stuff is outstanding other items are just okay. This happens at all restaurants. 

This is a great location. The kids menu is amazing. My kids love everything.

I love the concept of this restaurant. Their sauces and pasta are great.  I give it a 4 because i have had multiple experiences where the chicken is tough and too chewy, also because they need to invest in some good breadsticks!

This place is decent. It's like an Italian chipotle. I love the atmosphere of the place and service is friendly. I had the 7$ special and chose penne with a meat sauce. I have tasted better meat sauce. I did sneak a bite of my friends pesto and it was great! My penne was a little over cooked but the fact that you get a soup or salad and a breadstick was awesome. When I have a chance I am looking forward to trying some of the other menu options available.

It's pricey but really good.

If you have a craving for Mac and Cheese and don't want to make it at home, this is the place to be.

The food is good,a bit on the pricy side for just pasta. I wished they had revised there menu to make it more healthier overall. Very heavy on the calories, which makes me want to visit only once every few months.

The food was great! Our waiter, David, was fantastic! He checked on us and tried to make our meals as enjoyable as possible. However something went wrong in the kitchen and we waited for our food for over hour!!! If that wasn't ridiculous enough when management came over he didn't really even apologize he just seemed annoyed to even have to come over, it was absurd and made us all feel really uncomfortable! To top it off we barely got a discount! David was great but the management was unbelievably bad. Food was good as always

I'm more than displeased about this place, this is the first time I have had to update a review.

Every time I used my free garlic bread coupon when a short thin gentleman was working he would charge me anyway. 
This happened on 5 separate occasions. I find it hard to believe he is this incompetent. 
A little too shady for my taste. 

In addition the quality of food has declined. 

The staff play music of there choosing which I don't think is appropriate especially with kids around. 

I won't be returning, the blatant charging for sticks made of bread, stick bread and stick bread garlic sticks was the final straw, the last straw, the straw that broke the camels bank.

First time, didn't know what to expect. Friendly service food was good. Chicken Fettuccine Alfredo was really good very impressed. I think better than Olive Garden. Rigatoni Mac and cheese is delicious as well
I love this place, they have great pasta and several choices! My girl friend and I just love it.
Always delicious. This place is a win for me. Only reason why it's a 4 and not a 5 is because there is not a lot of side options and a tad bit pricey. Still amazing!!

I ordered the spinach artichoke with shrimp and sun-dried tomato... the shrimp were very small and the texture was mushy (precooked salad shrimp?) the artichoke was not evenly cooked, and the flavors were not there... 

Service was good, place was clean but the flavor is bland and was so unappealing that i tossed half the meal away and went to whole foods for a slice of pizza and a smoothie.

Food is good. Online ordering sucks. Have ordered twice now once for delicery once for pickup and they claim they haven't gotten either order even tho I have confirmations. Don't waste your time
Ordering online just go in if you want to eat there

"Hands down the best customer service from a restaurant. Each time I go the staff is awesome"

"The first time I went the noodles were a bit al dente..."

I'm sort of  between a 3.5 and a 4. Just not quite there. But honestly, I love this place. I love the atmosphere. I love the idea. In a whole it's just really a great place. Hands down the best customer service from a restaurant. Each time I go the staff is awesome. We'll chat and smile and they always seem sincere and genuine. None of this care-free standing around attitude even when the place is during its slow lulls. The pasta is good. The first time I went the noodles were a bit al dente, but since then its been better with each visit. I would recommend a cool revamp on the already trendy menu. Like a very different, dare I say exploratory recipe each month or so. Because that's the great thing about pasta there are endless amounts of ways to change it up. My fave is the crazy alfredo. Try it for yourself. My family has had less luck than I and have been ordering completely different things each time with not so great results. From their end their broccoli was a little raw or their chicken was slightly over-cooked making it chewy. I guess I understood what they meant, but have not had such bad experiences I couldn't easily overlook. I think you should definitely check it out for yourself. It is definitely "visit-worthy," if that's even really a thing? 

Also I'm a little confused on the tipping process. You order from the register first then sit-down and wait to be served. I want to be able to tip after the experience otherwise if it's too much for a bad service or too little for a great one it seems unfair to the server. Just my opinion.

I practically worship the Pepper Jack Mac and Cheese here, its absolutely phenomenal. Its creamy, slightly spicy but not enough that it's gross (I'm not a huge spice person, usually) and just all around wonderful. I really love the atmosphere of the place too, its kind of alternative/hipstery with the alternative music playing, giant chalk boards and black and white pictures.

Updated review for three stars because they still have still great food, but TERRIBLE phone service today.

 I've always loved Mac Shack ever since their first location and have been ordering delivery to my office once to twice a week. But today, I had the terrible, phone service from the shift manager over their so called "delivery charge". I've ordered the same entrees and had them delivered to my office and today, they refused to deliver because it didn't meet the $15 minimum delivery amount that I've never heard of. I know I've never paid for $15 dollars of mac shack for a single person. Anyways, I asked for them to look into my order history, which he rudely refused (not sure if he didn't want to or wasn't able to) and continued to debate with me and antagonize me to purchase more unnecessary, unwanted items. I told him he was very unprofessional and asked his age because it was as if I were debating with a frivolous child. Sadly enough, I did not get Mac shack today and I will probably not ever again since the management was very unpleasant, which is unusual. If this is Mac shacks policy now, my office and myself will no longer be giving them business since it was very convenient and the food is great, but there's no way to meet the delivery requirement unless we all want to have Mac shack on the same day .

Being from Colorado, I appreciate a place that reminds me of Noodles & Company. Both are great! If you get a "create your own" dish it will quickly add up, but it's quality food nonetheless. They also sell cupcakes from The Cupcakery. I will definitely be back!

Food is always great here but today the atmosphere was horrible.  They went from old jazz music that gives you that nice pasta/ Italian food type feel to punk rock alternative like offspring, nirvana, red hot chili peppers etc.  They were playing it fairly loud as well.  You could tell it was off an iPod as well because the cuss words were not bleeped out. Don't get me wrong I enjoy that music. But not when I'm trying to relax and enjoy my lunch. I asked them about it and the young kid Chris tried to make it right but the young manager there didn't give 2 shits.  Said he was to busy when we were pretty much the only guests in there. I come to relax and enjoy the food and the atmosphere helps with that.  The place is looking dirty as well now. 

Being an owner of a business that deals with guest experience, atmosphere is a huge deal!

Been here many many times and I will no longer come back!

My wife and I met up for lunch and we headed for Claim Jumper. We pulled in the parking lot and I noticed a sign that said "...pasta". The rest was blocked from view, so I started trying to figure out what it was. I found the name and looked it up here on Yelp. 

We changed our plans and decided to try something new. I had their Crazy Pasta (I think that's the name), but without jalapenos. It was really good. It contained noodles, alfredo sauce, sun dried tomatoes, chicken, shrimp, Italian sausage, red peppers, and green peppers.


My daughter had chicken fettuccine alfredo. My wife had some kind of pasta with shrimp in it. They both loved their food as well.

We also got a free order of bread sticks for checking with Yelp right before we ordered. We'll definitely be going back.
First time here, very enjoyable.  Maybe a little pricey, however, this time I had a groupon.  Kind of trendy, yuppie atmosphere, I'm 51 and felt like I still fit in tho.  Will return!

I love everything about this place. From the moment you enter to the moment you exit, you will be satisfied. 

It has somewhat of a hipstery feel, but you don't get the uppity hipster service, so it's just a really genuine and rustic vibe. They have a salivating selection of macs, as well as other entrées. Another plus is the free garlic bread you can get when you check in. They have really interesting flavors there. I also love the cool soda machine. They have a huge selection of sodas in there. How does that even work? It's a magical soda fountain. 

My favorites are the Truffle Mac and Smokehouse Mac. I'm starving just thinking about them! For dessert, sometimes I'll order a cute, freshly baked cupcake, or that scrumptious cannoli dip.

They serve huge portions, which is not a problem. You can save money on your next meal by not having to buy anything and you can just eat leftovers. They have lollipops for those who finish everything in one sitting!

I ordered the mac n cheese,  a house salad,  and a Newcastle Brown. The girl that I ordered from was a little wierd. I said I wanted a beer or wine recommendation and she recommended I come back on Wednesday when they're half price. Lol. She didn't have a name tag. My food came immediately. The cheese in the mac tasted wierd to me, the salad had a lot of dressing. The salad was good.  A staff member asked how my food was. I expressed my opinion about the food, a manager came out, talked to me about my food and refunded the price of the mac even though I'd consumed most of it.  I look forward to coming back and trying something else. I was very impressed with the service. I'll re-review when I come back to try something else.

I went to eat here and I really liked the style on the inside of the restaurant (even the bathrooms were really nice). Their menu is pretty unique, it took me a while to decide what I wanted. I ordered the buffalo chicken mac and cheese, and spaghetti and meatballs. I loved the buffalo chicken mac and cheese, I have never tasted any Mac and cheese like it! 

They have a rewards system for eating there too which is cool, but the cashier never told me about it. I heard the person in front of me using their rewards system, and when I asked my cashier about it she had already placed my order so I didn't get to use that orders' points. So make sure to ask about it before placing your order if you want to join! :)

This used to be my very favorite place for mac n cheese ever. I live in North Las Vegas and used to travel all the way to the old Warm Springs location (which was always better) before this one opened.  Today I wanted some comfort food, so I order some pepper jack mac to go, since I was nearby for an appointment. This is what I always order, as it's my favorite. I opened the container, after only 30minutes drive home and was horribly disappointed. All the macaroni was in one big clump and it didn't even look like there was much sauce on it. I tried to stir it and saw very little cheese either. I decided to call the store to ask for advice on heating it back up, which really wasn't needed as it was still hot, but I wanted that normal look and taste back. The gentleman told me he had no advice except stir it. He stated it's cheesy and it dries up. Well, needless to say. Nothing worked. It wasn't cheesy at all, it had no taste of pepper jack and still tasted like flour. This was a disappointment as I have noticed this restaurant in continually getting worse with its food flavor and prep. For someone to tell me on the phone, " I don't know what to tell you" makes me even more upset. I won't be traveling across town any more for my favorite dish, nor will I be getting it when I'm close for an appointment, as they just don't seem to know how to specialize in it anymore and they really don't seem to care. Saddens me greatly. Hopefully I'll be able to find my own recipe soon.
The smokehouse Mac is incredible! The regular Mac and cheese is good too, but the smokehouse is addicting and delicious
Great place for a quick family meal where everyone gets a choice.  Healthy options is you choose them. Kids love this place.

I really like the idea of Mac Shack's create your own pasta: pick a noodle, pick a sauce, and add in some ingredients. I enjoy getting the spicy red sauce and switching up the noodles. It's a good place to visit when you want quick pasta. The quality is good, and the atmosphere of the restaurant is fun. Unfortunately, I live too far away to make this a place that I regularly go to.

Great concept for a pasta place quick and easy pasta they prepare the food fresh. Transactions are done Like on the counter and they give you a number with which they deliver the food to your table. The quality and the quantity of the food was good. Place had a great feel to it, and the atmosphere was more of a family Deli. I would definitely come back to this place to try other pasta dishes.

The staff here is just plain rude and grumpy. I went in today and nobody was in there surprise surprise maybe if you guys were nicer to people they would want to come in. The one on warm Springs is way better and the people are way more friendly it surprises me these two locations are under the same management. I will never come to this location again. You could feel the negativity when you walk in and I was not having it

Changing it back to 5 stars because Scott Schubert reached out to me & clarify things mentioned in my last review.

the same holds true to my very first review for this place as well. quality food at affordable prices.

Outstanding. Came in here for a quick bite to eat and ended up leaving with enough leftovers for another meal. Located in the same shopping plaza as Barnes and Nobles. The set is really cute and cozy and I immediately loved the atmosphere.  I ordered the Cheddar Mac with a Caesar salad and both were so flavorful. My boyfriend did the create your own- penne  with pesto, mushrooms, and shrimp.
Will definitely return.

First trip to Mac Shack today and it was a great choice! I first noticed their store sign when I was going to Claim Jumper (which is in the same parking lot) a few months back. The wife & I decided we wanted to try it and today was the day!

Mac Shack is reasonably priced and very good quality food. It's a nice casual dining experience. I got the Philly cheesesteak Mac and my wife got the chicken Alfredo. Both were very tasty dishes. The space is big & although we didn't bring the kids  we could have. It's a very diverse menu & I will be back again to try something else. That's not to say I didn't enjoy my dish! Both were wonderful & we had some to take home to share with the rugrats. I even grabbed a lolly pop on the way out even though I didn't clear my plate! Shhhh don't tell anyone!

I recently ordered from the Mac Shack on West Charleston, and overall it was a good experience.  Not too many places specialize in just Mac and Cheese. Yet, this place does and has a good variety.

There are two sizes of mac and cheese you can order (regular and Mangia size).  I had the Cheddar Mac, Mangia size, and added bacon to it.  I must say that the amount of pasta that is in Mangia size is enough for a couple dinners (its THAT big).  However, the pasta was so good that I had no problem finishing it all. :-)  The added bacon was good but a bit thin.  I don't mind thin bacon (I prefer it to bacon that has pieces of fat), I just wish there was a bit more of it.  Also, it could have used a bit more sauce.  Regardless, I still very much enjoyed it and will order it again. :-)

Delivery was fast and courteous.  Can't ask for more than that. :-)

Overall, the Mac Shack was a pleasant experience with good food.  While the mac and cheese may not be the gooey kind that your mom (or mine) would make, it is still a great, tasty mac and cheese.

I went in there with my girlfriend and her 3 younger sisters. Our server was Chris and he made snickering comments to my girlfriend and was trying to make sexual remarks to my girlfriend's sisters her were 16, 14, and 12. Chris you are a pervert and I will never eat or bring anyone there ever again until your in prison you sicko!! UGH!!!
Pasta and cupcakes cannot beat that. The jazzy Sinatra and Tony Bennett music filling the space made me feel humbly in love with each bite of my pasta. My new place of serenity.
Very good made to order pasta! The gluten free pasta was a huge with my parents.  Staff is great, very friendly.

Great addition to the Vegas culinary scene. Before my first visit, I was afraid it was going to be some weird gourmet place but they have a great selection of hearty dishes, friendly and professional staff, and some great specials, like kids eating free on Sundays.
The young man behind the counter is a keeper paid close attention to us being gluten free! We came in and ordered for 12 people the staff was quick and the food was delicious
Diets are going well so time for one of our very favorite treats!! Great fresh pasta, loads of options on the menu, plus a build your own pasta dish option!! Love this place!!

The $8 lunch special, offered Monday-Saturday from 11AM-3PM, will get you a bowl of pasta, a side of soup or salad, a breadstick and a drink. You're free to add in pasta toppings for additional charges. 

Opted for the rigatoni with pesto, added mushrooms and gorgonzola (50 cents each), the side of mushroom soup, bread stick and an iced green tea. Ordered to go, ready in under 10 minutes, cute and modern decorating scheme, I have a weakness for chalkboard menus.

Pasta was a filling al dente portion with a perfect pesto, that didn't make me feel as if I'd ingested 1200 calories as I would at most Italian chain restaurants. Adding mushrooms and gorgonzola for a buck was both cheap and tasty. Could have done without the breadstick but holy shit that mushroom soup- I'd come back JUST for this soup, with the chunky bits of mushroom and full bodied flavor, enhanced by a drizzle of basil oil.

Only been one time. The food was ok,  nothing spectacular. Prices were middle of the road, fair for the portion sizes. Service was kinda slow, but the staff was friendly. I would go back. Good location as well, nice area.
Buffalo mac lots of flavor and good spice to it. Pepper jack is unique. Very shy with the jalepenos. #spiceallthethings

This location has awesome decor and ambiance.  It's super clean and the staff is friendly.  Great concept: You choose your pasta, then a sauce, and any toppings you want.  To-go orders are always packaged neatly and stay hot for a long time.  Good prices and big portions.  My favorite is the Pomodoro Fresco: Angel hair w/ fresh tomatoes, basil and light garlic w/ Parmesan and Romano cheeses.  The Baked Rigatoni is another great choice.  Rigatoni w/ meat sauce, mozzarella and baked ricotta. They can make a large variety of stuff so just ask if you want something extra special and they can probably do it. They serve China Mist brand iced tea which is one of the best tasting teas around.  

***Memory Bank this tip: The chicken noodle soup w/ or without Matzo balls is awesome to-go when you or your family isn't feeling 100%--quick and easy.

Yeah, good concept, but very expensive. How much does elbow macaroni cost? For 9.00 you should be able to take some home. Do you know that the pasta might coat them .75 cents if that? This place is way overpriced, and dont tell me that the cheeses cost them an arm and a leg. They should double the portion and then I would go back. It cost 28.00 for me and three kids for pasta. What a joke..Never again! Make it at home..will be closed in 2014

I was stoked to try this place out since they have gluten free pasta. I got the broccoli pesto with gluten free pasta. I took it to go but I feel like maybe if would have been better if I dined in because it was a mess. It was in the to go container and smelled so good in the car. I was excited to eat it but when I got home it was a huge disappointment. I open the box and it seemed like they poured too much pesto on the pasta or made the pesto with way too much oil. It was so excessive that it leaked through the bag and onto my leather seats which I noticed when it was way too late. I'm giving two stars because the pesto had good flavor but like I said, wayyyy too much oil. Oh and the cherry on top is that they gave me two little pieces of broccoli. If I order something called broccoli pesto, I expect it to have more than two measly pieces of broccoli. Ya'll need to step your game up. Summerlin is supposed to be known for good food. I don't think I'll be coming back again.

Decent prices; great food; very friendly service... Great lunch spot that has cool deals on different days of the week. The people that work here are very helpful and are willing to make your meal as enjoyable as possible don't feel bad asking for things to be your way when it comes to the food.
The one thing is they tend to over do on the sauce for my taste so ask for light sauce I didn't and had to ask for a little more pasta to mix in.

My family and I tried this place for the first time yesterday. They have a great selection of pastas, salads, and mac n cheese dishes. You can create your own bowl of pasta (choose the pasta, sauce, and  meat that you want) which is a great idea!  Very quick service and a friendly staff too!
I will definitely return for more.

This location made me poo myself something fierce!

Had to throw my unders away! 

I need new unders.

First time here and will definitely be back.  The food was fantastic.  

I got the truffle baked mac with tons of different cheeses, truffle oil (with a deft hand, people tend to overdo truffle oil and it goes from del ish to dirt super fast) and Ritz cracker crumb toasted perfectly in th oven.  The man got philly cheese steak mac and loved it.  We got a side of creamy corn to share which was so good.  We got an order of garlic breadsticks when we checked in was such a nice bonus.  We are bringing tons of leftovers home, even the man has leftovers and he's usually one to finish off his meal, the portions were huge for the price...yay leftovers! 

The staff was very polite, helpful and checked on us frequently.  The atmosphere was fun and the music selection had me singing along, everything from pearl jam, nirvana, incubus and The Beatles.  

Most definitely will our smiling mugs be seen in this fun mac and cheese place.  Thank guys!  Oh and don't tell but I didn't finish my plate but I'm going to pretend so I can have my free tootsie pop anyway ;)

Went in with a friend because we both love Mac and cheese and we were wanting to try this place for a while and honestly, it wasn't worth the drive. 
The pepper jack Mac and cheese was lacking flavor and the "garlic bread" tasted just like plain bread.
My friend got the truffle Mac and cheese and it wasn't that good either.
But the cashier and the other workers greeted us and where very helpful since it was our first time.

My boyfriend and I went to Mac Shack yesterday and ordered our pasta to go. We both did build your own and it cost us over $25. Little pricey for fast food. We sat down in the dining room that only had about 4 other people. We waited quite a while and kept watching for our food. We saw them walk a to go order out and were sure it was finally ours but it was for someone who came in after us. I went up to the counter and asked about our food and it was sitting back there the whole time! They said they had called our names, but I don't believe they did since the place was practically dead, we would have heard it. On top of that, the food was mediocre and the bread sticks were stale.

Ehhhh. It was good. That's about all I can say. Wasn't bad, wasn't great...nothing to write home about. The music they had on in there was super annoying, however. When you go to eat somewhere, the music should be background noise, not so loud and so lyric intensive that you can't hear who you came to eat with. The upside, though, is that they can make something for everyone: gluten free, vegan, vegetarian. For that reason alone I will give them another try honestly. Also, make sure to get the free garlic bread when you go with the Yelp check in/unlock feature. That was actually VERY good!

Cool concept. Pasta is the main theme here, but they also have bread, soups, salads and desserts. You can either choose their pre-built pasta selections or build your own. U didn't want to build my own, so I went with the Crazy Alfredo and added a side salad. My meal was boxed and ready in less than 5 minutes. 

Crazy Alfredo, has chicken, Italian sausage, shrimp, roasted red pepper, sun-dried tomatoes, mushrooms and jalapeños with fettuccine and alfredo sauce. To be honest, I was underwhelmed by the dish. If I like a meal, I usually eat it fairly quickly. I found myself taking long breaks in between bites and contemplating whether or not to save the rest for my bf, which ended up happening. I enjoyed the salad. It was really fresh with tomatoes, onions and a really tasty vinaigrette dressing. I don't know why this place fell short for me, but I will be back to try some of their other creations. They have a couple styles of mac and cheese that tickled my fancy, and a dessert called cannoli chips and dip that sounds amazeballs.
Hot damn, could this be a new obession!?!? My thighs say NO my heart says HELL YES

wow... this place is great. easy parking, easy ordering, great pricing and a great menu. great fresh tasting food. we will def be back :) i highly recommend this place. i had the grilled cheese made with mac and cheese and it was unreal. ceaser salad was great too.. she had meatballs and a house salad and loved it as well. 

as an added perk - nic cage was in there with his family :) hey, nic cage cant be wrong right? the guys stole the declaration of independence - i think he knows where to find good food :)

Only been once but will definitely be back!

Got the lunch special and I had penne with Alfredo and a Cesar salad. Got all that plus a breadstick and drink for $8. Can't beat that and it was quite good! The portion size was more on the pick two size from panera which I'm more than okay with. Both filling and the pasta and sauce are fired right there. No over done noodles or ones that have been sitting around for awhile! 

Be aware that when you order a signature item that they can be decent in size (talking leftovers here!!!). I will say I wish the breadstick was a tiny bit bigger but that's about it!

Also, if you clear off your table and plate, you get a tootsie pop! I thought it was a joke but they have them right there as you leave. Very fun and good food.

We stopped here for dinner before we saw a movie. It's sort of almost like a pasta version of Chipotle, although building your own bowl of pasta would get pricey fast...the base of noodles and sauce is almost $8, each meat is about $2, and any other ingredients are .65 a piece. The non-build-your-own pastas are generally a good deal comparatively. My husband got the Crazy Alfredo, and I got the Philly Cheese Steak Mac. 

The garlic cream sauce in the Alfredo was DELICIOUS. Mine was good too, but his was definitely tastier. The servings are quite large, and using the free garlic bread check-in deal was no problem.

I got the truffle Mac and cheese with double chicken. The Mac and cheese was tasty, but I could have made better at home. The chicken that was used in my entree tasted like it was reheated or microwaved and for the price of the food I would have expected better. I may give it another try i

I can't believe it took me so long to try this place out! There is a location right down the street from where I live, and this one is right down the street from where I work! It is like my carb destiny!

This restaurant is probably the perfect balance between fast food and casual restaurant. The inside is bright and charming, the employees are friendly, and the service is fast. All of the entrees cost between $8-$12 on average, so it is not a place you'll break the bank.  Mac Shack is great for a quick, casual lunch with a friend or co-worker when you don't have enough time for something more formal, but don't want fast food or subs.

When you walk in, you are greeted with a large overhead menu. You place your order and pay at the counter, then if you are dining there, you're given a number placard and a server will bring your food. The service was great, and we were checked upon several times during the course of our meal.

I ordered the Crazy Alfredo, without the jalepenos. In retrospect, that might have been a bad decision, because it did need some additional seasoning. Aside from that, it was great- lots of meat, mushrooms, and sun dried tomatoes. It was very cheesy, and the pasta was cooked just right. I decided to only eat a little and save the rest for dinner. The serving size was plentiful and I would have been full if I'd eaten the whole thing. My friend ordered the Broccoli Pesto Pasta without chicken (she's a vegetarian), and she finished everything. 

I was very pleased with the Mac Shack and look forward to trying other dishes- and they have a mac & cheese grilled cheese sandwich?! What!

Nice atmosphere and decent food. I had the Pepper Jack Mac and Cheese which was just the right amount of cheesy and spicy. I previously came and created my own pasta I noticed it was lacking salt. I had the same problem when I tried my moms pasta but that could just be my taste buds. Overall, it's a good place to pick up a quick meal.

I work close to this Mac Shack and went during my lunch break for the first time.  I had the Spinach and Artichoke Mac.  Good portion size and very tasty!  Staff was friendly.  Menu has a great selection and make your own mac/pasta dish.  Prices are very reasonable.  I definitely recommend!
Carb city! Tried this place and I won't be back. Over priced, cheap pasta and cheap tasting flavors. If you crave pasta try any Italian restaurant instead.
Great first time experience...food tasted fresh and great! I had the crazy Alfredo and it was done very nicely...Will go back definitely

What can I say...it is fabulous! I can't get enough of the jalapeño mac. Kids eat free on Sundays so if that is a deal breaker come another day.
Wonderful spin on a comfort food everyone loves. They also have desserts spaghetti, salads & soups.

I'm a fan of this place.  I really enjoy that they have farro with just olive oil and garlic.  Very simple and flavorful.  They also have that really cool soda machine, but the thing about that is I don't drink soda.  I will be back again just for the farro.

I've been at the Summerlin location multiple times and finally decided to do a review! 

The Summerlin location is way better than the Warm Springs location! I keep coming back to this location because they have better service, the food tastes a lot better, it's cleaner, and the architecture gives a more rustic feel as opposed to the warm springs location... Which makes you feel like you're walking in to a Cici's pizza. No thanks !  

The price is reasonable and they are very generous with their portion size. I always get the cheddar mac and end up taking half home (unless I'm starving, then I can finish the whole thing). I was just here yesterday, and my bf decided to be dangerous and try the grilled Mac and Cheese... To our surprise, it was delicious for a Grilled Cheese sandwich. 

Like a fatty, I came back today and had brunch with my brother. I tried the grilled Mac and cheese again. It was Soo good ! 

The staff is amazing and always nice right when you walk in. 


Summerlin location all the way!

Visited on 7/9/2014

Food: Ordered the Smokehouse Mac; the bacon was a nice touch, although I did not really taste the bbq sauce the menu mentions. Still pretty good.

Service: The cashier was helpful and quick, and the server was knowledgeable and very polite.

Good amount of food for a decent price. I ordered the create-your-own pasta dish, which was delicious. I would have given 5 stars, but the cashier helping my party told us she could take us and as we were getting ready to pay she made us wait while she took a long phone call. Thankfully, the other staff member helped us after he realized we were waiting awhile. Overall this place was really good, definitely coming back.

The only location left in Vegas...theee best food! Service good, they just deliver, you order & pay up front. 1 toilet per gender. Drinks are sodas but unlimited. I prefer good teas, or others. Love this place...especially the lollipops as you leave the restaurant. Except not this week...March 23....no lollipops..why?

If you are willing to embrace your inner child, this is the perfect dinner scene!  It's totally cool! 

I went last night and ordered the Smokehouse, which is made with bacon, BBQ sauce, and gouda. It was delicious!  Truthfully, the pasta is a little over cooked, but I really don't mind.

I also ordered a pitcher of sangria, which was good, but tasted like a little cheap red wine mixed with a lot of cranberry juice and a sh*t-ton of ice. What's cool is the price of sangria on Saturday- normally a pitcher costs $24 but Saturdays it's  $15! They add lemon/orange slices and maraschino cherries, which was also cool, but it's still not really sangria and you won't get a buzz. Womp womp.

I would TOTALLY revisit and try other stuff on the menu- especially since prices seem pretty fair (if they're actually using the ingredients they list on their menu). I liked having the option of sitting outside,  too.

Came in for lunch on a Saturday, place was pretty bomb. I had the Crazy Alfredo and my gf had the Farmhouse pasta and we shared a green salad. In hindsight we could have shared one pasta and salad as it was a ton of food. Good value, most options are in the $7-10 range and serving size is generous.

I get the truffle baked Mac and cheese every time. I absolutely love it. The service is wonderful and very fast. I don't ever wait very long for anything. Everyone there is so nice and sweet. They are always very patient with me when I take so long to look at the menu just to get the same thing I always get. Sometimes I will be adventurous and I am never disappointed.

Love this place!! Their creamy tomato soup is my daughters favorite thing in the world right now, and my favorite is their spinach and artichoke mac with capers. Aside from the great food, the vibe here is totally chill and all the employees are all friendly and courteous. Definitely a place we'll continue to visit regularly.

Save your money and buy a box of Kraft Mac and cheese
Will not be going back
Goes into the top two worst meals I've had in Vegas in 8 years!!! Yuck

My 2 Stars goes more for the customer service.....it's horrible....waited an hour for our garlic bread and which ultimately we don't get. The food is ok nothing special you wouldn't be able to make at home.

I was so indecisive coming in here that I just ended up building my own pasta. I ended up getting a bowtie, pesto, and bacon combination. I LOVED THE PESTO. It was so delicious! 

The only downside was the amount of bacon they put. I only had one "big" piece, and the rest were crumbles/bits. They were lacking :((((

The whole menu sounds delicious, but I went with the Philly Cheese Steak Mac n Cheese. I made a good decision. The mac n cheese is creamy with a lot if stretchy cheese. The veggies and steak in it were also cooked really well. They also use a good amount of pepper and I loved that. The service was friendly and really quick. It's also pretty affordable, and if you can control yourself there's also plenty for leftovers the next day.
I got the cheddar mac and it tasted like plain noodles, not enough cheese to see or taste
Yum, first time here and it was pretty delicious. I had some reservations after reading some of the reviews but I was pleasantly surprised. Food was fast and tasty, the customer service was great.

Perfect place for week night dinner with the kiddos before cub scout meeting!! They get to pick their pasta, pick their sauce, veggie, protein and drink from the Big machine and they love it! If they are done they're allowed to get a lollipop too. Zero stress. The dinner is ready before we're even done figuring out what lemonade variation to get. And we like the dance-y music too!! Easy peasy!!

Perfection. From your Togo containers, to your lighting fixtures-- my husband and I are in love. The food selection for me, a vegetarian variation that eats fish, loved the "make your own" pasta with Alfredo, shrimp and broccoli. It was amazing. Your food runner looked like Puck from Glee, and I liked that too. The mother load of soda machines is there as well, offering a vast amount of drinks; my favorite- Cherry Vanilla Dr Pepper. So good! My husband and I will be back very shortly. I think maybe tonight. Mhmmmm

This place falls to the bottom of my list of honest restaurants - they are scam artists. I can't justify giving them any more money when their flavor and culinary execution is mediocre and they scam people out of proper portions.

Here's what we ordered: 

Create your own: fettuccine + alfredo + chicken + garlic + sun dried tomatoes + crimini mushrooms + basil. The fettuccine noodles were cooked a minute or 2 past al dente, yet the alfredo sauce was actually creamy, rich and satisfying and I tasted some garlic, not too much. The sun dried tomato flavor was muted, they were not tangy or sweet - they tasted like they came straight out of a can and soaked in preservatives. The basil looked like someone sneezed one leaf onto the dish, just tiny specs here and there - it was truly nonexistent and not worth adding. Also, the pre-cooked/processed, bland, chicken was overcooked, dry, and rubbery - it really tasted like the cooked chicken that is packaged in the refrigerated section of the supermarket. However, I'll admit the overall pasta portion size was decent. I mean, if you must, and you have a pasta-carbo-loading-emergency, I would recommend trying the pasta here and judge for yourself - you might get your satisfaction. But! Be careful and don't have high expectations...you might end up in a better position than me. Flavor rating: 3/5

Create your own: gnocchi + pesto + garlic + cremini mushrooms. They are way too heavy handed with the oil here. It was swimming in at least 4-5 tablespoons of oil. The oil soaked gnocchi were soggy, mushy and didn't have any bite to them. Plus, the (oily) pesto lacked so much freshness and flavor - that's a pesto no-no. Pesto craving = unsatisfied. The portion on this one was the size of a petite women's fist, but I guess that's not a bad thing since it was terrible anyways. Flavor rating: 1/5

We also ordered the sweet corn and the mushroom soup with basil oil. The taste of both soups were far from memorable. The consistency of the mushroom soup was thick, gritty, and too unpleasing to the palate. It tasted like someone's haphazard kitchen experiment. The flavor of this soup was really weak and one-noted, I also didn't taste any earthiness or nutty flavor of mushrooms. Not to mention, the gorgeous basil oil drizzle was a gimmick- pretty color, but no taste. What's the point? It all falls to the bottom of my flavor radar. Flavor rating: 1/5

I found preference in the sweet corn soup, yet, it's still never something that I would need to order again. It had a slightly sweet, smooth texture, milky and not too creamy (no corn kernels detected.) For corn fanatics, I still wouldn't recommend this soup because of the horrendous serving size they try to get away with giving you. Flavor rating: 3/5

I'm irked and extremely disappointed in their soup to-go serving portions. They told us that they only offer 1 size, and for $4, the serving is much less than a standard sized coke can! It was literally 3 tablespoons worth of soup - It's seriously a prank on how little soup they gave us. I felt extremely offended and robbed. How do you pull off charging $4 for 3 sips of soup? I would never, ever, recommend the soups here - a total scam! (Refer to my 2 pictures of their soups side-by-side to a coke can to see their disturbing portion size) 

Oh, and about their Yelp check in offer: 1 order (2 pieces) of free, dry-as-cardboard-and-no-garlic-seasoning "garlic bread" was terrible. Lets just put it this way - If I tossed it at a window it would definitely shatter. Thanks but no thanks. Free things are great, but why even bother? It's a waste of food! (Even scavenger/bread loving pigeons would turn their beak away from these) Flavor rating: 0/5

Consider yourself duly warned.
Ran up on this little place last night. The decor and the smell of delicious food was awesome. Big portions and decent pricing. Def coming back

I kinda like this place.....from the BYO pasta dish option, to going with their menu creations, to the free garlic bread with Yelp check in.  Upon entering the young man at the counter had some personality and swagger you don't see at corporate pasta chains like OG.  We were greated promptly and ordered quickly. No 45 minute wait to be seated here. F*** that.  

After ordering the food was delivered quickly to the table worth or lucky number.  The presentation was clean and simple and the portions large enough to share.   We ordered the Spinach Artichoke Mac which was very tasty.  The artichokes were very tender and delicious.  

Our side salad add on was very large as well. I thought we could have had more dressing on the chopped romaine and quartered tomato with sliced red onion but it was still tasty.   The bread sticks were served warm and seasoned appropriately with butter and Italian seasoning.

I like the lolly pops available if you clean your plate at the end of your meal.  They work great for encouraging the kids to finish their meal.  

Overall great visit!  Next time I will drive by the other two places for pasta and head right to Mac Shack.

Connie and I went for a quick dinner. She ordered the Crazy Alfredo and I the Asiago Mac 'n Cheese. They were both excellent. I was afraid the blue cheese would be too overpowering but it was mild. It was creamy with a nice touch of crunch from toasted breadcrumbs. 
Although Connie doesn't eat jalapenos and they won't make substitutions on dishes, she of course didn't eat any, but they imparted a nice flavor and mild heat to her dish. So like Arnold Schwarzenegger, we will be back.
The garlic bread left allot to be desired but no big deal. I like the soda machine with a gazillion flavors...pick a beverage and add any flavor shot. These machines are gaining in popularity.
Not a huge fan of no substitutions, but I get it...with all the ingredients, it would add lots of wait time to tailor orders. Looking forward to trying something Italian though. It's a pasta place after all, so the true test will be a red sauce. I'll add another star if the next visit works out!

I've passed this place a million times and finally decided to stop in. I got a few things to go and decided I would try a few of their signature macs. The pasta and breadsticks were good but my favorite part was a grilled cheese sandwich with Mac and cheese instead of just cheese it was different and actually was surprisingly really good. I ordered the Philly cheesesteak Mac and the bbq Mac both were good. Service was really fast and the girls in the front were very nice. I will return here In the future for sure.
yum!  so excited they now have zoodles!!!  always delicious and fast!  the employees are super friendly, too!

I've been coming to the salon next door for months and I can't believe I am just now trying this place! It's so good and easy to customize your order. I don't eat much pasta, so the fact that they had a way to order meats and veggies with the sauce still made my day. Plus, it was fast and incredibly reasonably priced for the quality of food.

Food was OK but not worth the price!  To add insult to injury, the cashier (Brittany) double charged us (extra $28!) then after the fact let us know that the overcharge would go back onto our account for at least 5 days! We came well before closing; however, many items for drinks (especially the lemons we love to put in the drinks) were already taken away for the night.  To the manager's credit, he did go back and get lemons for us.  All in all, I wouldn't waste my money at this eatery again.

If I could give them four and half stars I would!

My boyfriend and I went here Friday night. We really liked the concept. Pasta customization, cool! We ordered the asiago bleu mac and cheese for me, crazy alfredo for him, gnocci with pesto, mushrooms, and sun dried tomatoes and bread sticks to share. I loved my mac and cheese! The bleu wasn't too overwhelming, but still had that bite you expect with bleu cheese. The crazy Alfredo had A LOT in it. Chicken, Italian sausage, steak, and shrimp in a roasted pepper alfredo sauce. I personally did not try it, but my boyfriend said it was very good! 

The only reason for the half star would be for the size of the shrimp and the beer selection. The shrimp were pretty tiny. The pasta only cost a little over $10 but he said that he would have been happier with three big ones versus a few little guys. We were pretty happy to see that they serve beer and wine, but the selection was minimal. My boy is a beer guy so of course he wanted more. 

Overall we loved it. We'll definitely be back and indulge in our carb intake here!

Cheezy, Gooey, Mac-a-Liscousness!!!!
This may become my new go-to for comfort food fixes!!

We all ordered different pastas, so that we could taste each others.
ALL WERE YUMMY!!! And ALL UNDER $10 BUCKS!!
Right?? DO I have your attention now??

I had the Smoke House - Gouda Cheese, bacon. How can you go wrong?
The other two were Taco Mac- Delish! 
And the Buffalo Mac.....might have been the favorite at the table!

Started with garlic bread sticks (FREE with Yelp Check-in!) And I hate to snub a free gift, but honestly they were kinda bland. But clearly fresh baked, so points for that!

Over All - LOVED LOVED LOVED coming here. Delicious.
I love love love Mac Shack.  The Shrimp Scampi is the best!!
I had the smokehouse Mac n cheese and it was great! Thanks for the free garlic bread for checking in!!!!  The atmosphere is great and service was fast.

Anytime I am in the mood for pasta, I always order from Mac ShACK!

Sucks that you guys don't deliver anymore though!

When I come to Vegas I try my best to stop here. If you love pasta then this place is for you. You can make your own pasta from choosing the noodles, protein, sauce, and vegetables. This location in particular is okay. My food had to be redone because it was made wrong and the toilet in the bathroom was leaking water all over the floor when I was there. However, it is a must try.

Great place. Relaxing atmosphere! Family loved the food. I had the cheddar Mac it was a little bland but then tried my husbands dish and it was delicious!! Kids loved it and my son was raving about their meatballs.

I'm so sad. I've heard so many great things about this place, but their cheddar Mac tasted like macaroni with butter. There was no cheese at all. Maybe you need to eat it there, but heated up was tasteless. Too bad.

I had the gluten free Mac and cheese with bacon and onion, Caesar salad and cauliflower au gratin. No, not all in the same sitting. 

The pasta was...meh. Very salty and I likely wouldn't get it again. However, the Caesar salad and cauliflower au gratin were both outstanding! The cauliflower was blanched and nice and crunchy and smothered in a delicious cheese mixture. The salad was incredibly fresh and not drowned in sauce. I will definitely be back to order these again. The full size salad was WAY too big for one person so I'd go with the side salad next time.

I am the freaking QUEEN of pasta! I could eat it morning, noon, and night!  And then for snacks in between. This place just reigns awesomeness. 

So here is how it works. You can either build your own pasta by picking the type of noodles, sauce, meats, and extras. OR you can pick from their lovely pastas...but if you pick one of their pastas there are NO subs! 

I have only gotten the Crazy Alfredo. Which is just a freaking party in your mouth. It has Alfredo sauce, chicken and shrimp, jalapeños, mushrooms, sun dried tomatoes...and I'm sure I'm missing a few things. Oh! And it even gets better....they have...gluten free options!!!!! 

The decor of the place is super cute. They have a bunch of daily specials and you can enter your number at the reg for a frequent pasta freak tracker. 

Just the BEST!

Truffle baked mac - 4
Mac and cheese with delicious prominent truffle flavor.
Crunchy awesomeness parmesan atop entire tray.
I'm a spice lover so I added red peppers.
Gooey heart melting cheese.
Pasta not overcooked dry.
Hot outta oven - dish served over another tin tray.

Broccoli chicken pesto - 2
Noodles were hotter than the chicken.
Chicken seemed possibly heated up in microwave then mixed in with penne pasta and pesto sauce.
Only their broccoli and chicken portions, and flavor were good.

White sangria from Spain - 3
Purchased entire bottle.
Was fixed up in a carafe with slices of orange, lemons, and cherries on ice. 
Served in two glasses.
Nice presentation.
Ice watered it down.

Only if I have visitors that particularly want gluten free and/or pasta would Mac Shack be a future option. This place was on Nessa's bookmarks. Not generally the type of food I crave. I'm glad I enjoyed at least a couple things here.

I had never been considered a regular anywhere before, or taken the time to express my love for an establishment, until I discovered Mac Shack. They have a salad bar, but for pasta!!! They have great lunch, weekly, and rewards specials too! A couple  examples are Wine down Wednesday 50% off bottles, and kids eat free on Sundays when you dine in!!! Their Pepper Jack Mac is incredible; I highly recommend it. I swear it's the only thing I've missed since going Vegan, but lucky for me, and all you lovely vegans out there, they have a Vegan menu, and don't use egg noodles! So now they have me hooked on their marinera sauce. They have great employees too!!! Brad and Angel are amazing. Above all else, they don't play the same mainstream bullshit music we are constantly bombarded with almost everywhere else!!! Everyone needs to try this place.
Tried calling for about 30 mins straight during business hours, but nobody ever picked up.  Very disappointing and unprofessional.

Mac Shack WAS a favorite place of mine but recently their quality of food has declined greatly! My family and I had dinner there this evening, the chicken was rubbery and dish was cold. Breadsticks tasted old and lukewarm at best. This is an ok place, it's quick and the staff is friendly. Not on the cheap side of things, 2 adults and 1 child = $45.00. 
Not a fan anymore!

I loved this place. I only tried it for the first time last night but it was amazing! I got the spaghetti and meatballs but with angel hair pasta instead of spaghetti and it was so good! I had enough for leftovers the next day. Make sure to do the check in special and get your free garlic bread. That was delicious. Definitely gonna be eating here again!

Oooo, the Mac Shack. I've been hearing a lot about this place in the past year, but never gave this place a shot until my friends and I decided to give it a try.

You hear the name of the place and more than likely, the firs thing that comes to your mind is macaroni and cheese. That is something they definitely have for you to get and try out, but they also have some delicious pastas to try out as well. Their menu selections of pastas are decent, and the macaroni selection is a little less as well, but what their menu may lack in selection, makes up for it in customization; they have build your own pasta with many different kids of sauces, pastas, meats, and fillings. With that in mind, they also have some salads and different sides you can add to your meal, and even a few sandwiches, one of which that seems interesting enough, a grilled PB&J. On my visit though, I didn't get the PB&J on this visit, but I did get the cauliflower gratin with my pasta, which was called bottle service. 

Bottle service comes in penne pasta and the pasta was cooked al dente and just right. The sauce went very well with the pasta and the sirloin beef & mushrooms. If you order bread and dip it into the pasta sauce, it makes for a delicious meal ahead of you. The cauliflower gratin was very good. The cauliflower wasn't too soft and soggy, and had the right amount of crunch. The crumbs, cheese, and sauce put on top of the cauliflower made for some delicious side bites to go along with my pasta. One bonus, is that with a yelp check in, you get free garlic bread! The garlic bread that I ate wasn't too garlicy, or even had a real garlic taste to it, but it did taste like the bread they make from pretzels to me, just a teeny bit. Another bonus about this place is that they have that fancy soda machine that is only one machine and has that wide selection of various drinks and additives you can add to your beverage for ultimate customization. This can be bonus to some, or not, but when you are done eating, you don't have to really clean up after yourself, the staff cleans up after you, so that's awesome in itself to me!

Overall, I loved the feel that I got while I was in Mac Shack. The staff was friendly, the food was delicious, and the environment was amazing. Give this place a visit for a casual meal with family and/or friends!

If you're in the mood for Mac & cheese, this is the spot! Great location, always clean and great portion sizes. Only knock on them is they could have a better drink selection. 

My absolute favorite is the "Smokehouse Mac" smoked gouda and bacon then I add chicken...once you smell it you know right away you made a great choice.
First time here that truffle baked mac was amazing they have a great lunch spacial that I will be back to try it's super cute inside super yummy

Love this place. Never thought there were so many ways to make noodles and sauce. Bottle service is by far my favorite. It's perfect great food that I love and so does my 3 year old; now that's rare. The do to go service too!

Oh my gosh! This is the cutest little place! My family and I came here on a Sunday with a party of 5. The atmosphere is contemporary in our opinion & the service was superb! The guy in from (a pity I do not know his name, but he did have tattoos and facial hair :) made the beginning of our stay memorable and positive. He was attentive and sweet. With out a doubt it's a perfect place to take the family for a little lunch or dinner. We ordered the baked rigatoni, kids mac'n cheese, create your own pasta, sweet corn soup, and hedge salad (my least favorite.. Only because I am not a blue cheese lover.) but if you're a blue cheese lover that salad is awesome! All in all this restaurant gets a 5 out of 5. Food and service was awesomely awesome! :) everyone should eat here at least once!
Comfortable atmosphere, friendly service. Price versus great food... a most try if nothing else! Twice in one day and family loves it

This place is fantastic.  The Truffle Baked Mac and Buffalo Chicken Mac were incredible and the bread sticks were soft a flavorful.  The prices are reasonable and the portion size is generous.  Do yourself a flavor and go there today.

Went to lunch a little later the other day and went to Whole Foods. The selection wasn't looking so great so I turned to Yelp, of course, to find nearby and interesting options. Mac Shack was in the same plaza. I saw this place over a year ago when I first moved to Vegas and was supposed to try this place sooner, but never did. I honestly love their slogan, Fork and Spoon Forever; it reminds me of some of my relatives' homes in HI when I was growing up. They had the super-sized wooden fork and spoon hanging decor in the dining room.

Anyway, this being my first time and my lunch break, I was pleasantly surprised that it wasn't a sit down restaurant. There were two people in front of me, so it gave me a little more time to view the menu selections. I was sold on the Taco Mac after the server showed me the large cereal sized bowl it comes in.

So my belief is that if you have to add more condiments to your dish to meet your taste preference, then the dish isn't so great. With that being said, there wasn't a need for me to add parmesean cheese or ketchup or siracha. Not too much sour cream on top and it did compliment the taste of the dish. It came with a few  stale tortilla chips. And i do wish it had a little more ground beef. I was able to dig right in, it wasn't scalding hot that I would burn my tongue. My first bite ended with drooping cheese on my chin, which I think is awesome. So every bite thereafter, I needed to cut the cheese, not in the childish context. I could only finish half of my dish. 

I didn't get a chance to read the tips from other yelpers on this place, but the restaurant tips are literally part of the decor on the walls. 

1. Monday night is meat-free night, meaning vegetarian dishes are 20% off.  
2. Tuesdays, kids eat free
 3. Wine down Wednesdays
4. M - F lunch combo is $7.95
5. They have an app so if you're in the area, you can order and pick up or they can deliver.

Oh, and the bathrooms! Very clean! The wall has a huge photo mural that also covers the bathroom door, making it a little hard to fond.  The sink is a huge pasta pot, one of the coolest things ever seen! 

Friendly staff + good food + great deals + comfortable atmosphere + super clean bathroom = 4.5 stars, rounded up to 5 STARS and me coming back for more with family and friends.

We visited the new location tonight for a late dinner. After ordering and paying, one of the line cooks made derogatory remarks in Spanish about my boyfriend and myself. We were the only patrons in the restaurant so it was clear the comments were about us. Whether he thought we didn't speak Spanish or thought we couldn't hear him, it was completely unacceptable in 2014 to be such a hateful, homophobic ass! We immediately asked for a refund and left without eating.

First time to Mac Shack. I was pleasantly surprised by the quality of the food. But the chicken Alfredo was every bit as good as what I've had at other chain, high end restaurants. You order everything piece by piece. So if you don't want a salad don't order one. But if you've got a killer appetite there's no shortage of options. Also have a wide selection of sodas, but only two options if you want Tea. The staff was pleasant and friendly and checked on us several times. I should point out that this is not table service orders but go through line and order what you want and then go get your drink and puck your table or booth. They bring the food to your table and the service was fast. No complaints, this was a great place to stop in for a quick and delicious Italian lunch or dinner.

We had a party of 5 and everything we ordered was amazing. My boyfriend and I shared the broccoli pesto and the shrimp scampi. So good. My mom ordered the crazy fettuccine (I think that's the name?) Which was also great. My sister's regular fettuccine was good as well; I can't remember what my mom's boyfriend got but I know he loved it. I'm not a cupcake person but for dessert we got the German chocolate, lemon, & red velvet. German chocolate and lemon were SO good. I'm not a fan of red velvet but my sister liked it. My mom's boyfriend got the cannoli chip dessert & that was great too. I loved the idea, very different. Everything was so great I couldn't even decide what was my favorite.

Tried Mac Shack for lunch with my wife.  It's a cafeteria style concept with fixed menu items or design your own pasta.   I ordered the Angel Hair with fresh tomato sauce and my wife had the Caprese Grilled Cheese sandwich.  Food was just ok....my pasta sauce had a strange chemical like taste and was overloaded with garlic.  I ate about one-third of the large bowl full.  My wife's Caprese sandwich was better than my pasta, although the bread became soggy very quickly, from the tomatoes, I suppose. 

We waited what seemed like a long time for our meals to be delivered. 

The restaurant is spacious and has a nice, clean, retro-industrial vibe.  The restaurant staff was friendly and the overall service was very good. 

We'll probably try Mac Shack again; it's a great Pasta "fast food plus" concept that has potential and deserves a second chance. 

Suggestion to the restaurant is to put menus on the tables so diners can explore all the options. Currently, there's only a single large board menu hanging above the food line which is hard to read from the dining area.

- Decor - 
Even as I was pulling up to the restaurant in the complex I was getting giddy. I could tell just driving by that the decor and ambiance itself is something I'll fall madly in love with. And I was right! Their style is how I want to base my whole life around! My future home, my product labeling (if I were to sell something), my coffee shop (if I were to open one), my clothing store (if I were to somehow build one), my children. Yes even my children. I want their whole being to somehow represent this simple, minimalistic, vintage style. It was a beautiful day and they kept their doors open, but even if they didn't this restaurant is very bright and spacious with simple accent pieces to make it more elegant. For example, the chalk art on the walls, and the deep burgundy booths. LOVE LOVE LOVE!

- Ordering - 
You order at the counter and they give you a number marker. They have special deals everyday! On Saturdays they offer a $7.99  lunch special - side salad or soup, 1 piece of garlic bread, and a build it your own pasta. You get to choose the pasta and sauce but any additional toppings is extra charge. Ze boyfriend went with the Smokehouse Mac and ordered Cauliflower Gratin. As you finish with your order, and you walk towards the tables, you can see a small section of  fresh produce piled like at the grocery market behind the counters and they also keep their working space very open so you can see the cleanliness of the kitchen. 

- Food - 
The food didn't take too long to come out. My caesar salad was delicious and was very fresh. As my pasta, I ordered a basil pesto wheat pasta with broccoli and mushrooms, it was alllrightt. Too bland for my taste. I can only say the Smokehouse Mac was only okay too. It was too sweet, but I guess that should be expected if you're going for that hickory smoked bbq flavor. The Cauliflower Gratin sealed the deal on 4 stars rather than 5. I could have let my experience with the rest of the meal slide, but not the Cauliflower Gratin. Although it was good, it got me questioning if they had Paula Dean back there preparing it cause that thing was just straight up fat and oil. I posted a picture to show the insane amount of oily greasy mess that took up the bottom half of the bowl. The description on the menu said it was seasoned with parmesean and mozzarella cheeses but I didn't realize by seasoned, they really meant 'swimming in', I tried one just so I could review it, and that's all I could have. 

That heart-threatening side item won't keep me away though. I'm still very interested in coming back and trying all the other items.

Can't get enough of this place. My favorite is the the farmhouse with spaghetti, roasted garlic and mushrooms. It's super creamy with the just the right amount of saltiness coming the the pancetta. Plus, I don't feel so bad about eating cream sauce cause I ate my vegetables in the form of peas!

I have eaten here in the past, but after the service today we will be sure to never return!!! We placed an order to be delivered at 12 to our school with well over an hour before hand. Not only did our meals not show up until 12:45, even better was the horribly rude man on the phone when I called to check on our order.
