He said all he would do was give me a $10 credit and he didn't know what to tell me, granted we ordered $100 worth of food, they were busy and the food is gone. He was so rude and kept snapping at me. His name was Brad, so I will be sure to contact the General Manager as well!!! This was a meal for 7 different teachers and we only have about 20 minutes to eat. So thanks for that Mac Shack!

Ordered take-out via Postmates and was impressed yet again! This time, I got the baked rigatoni with a small caesar salad on the side. Such a hearty portion, so satisfying. I'll be munching on this for the next day or so, for sure!
I heard of the Mac shack from some friends so I decided to try it out. Nice design inside but the food is overpriced for what u get 8 dollars for elbow macaroni? Sorry not buying what you are selling

First visit today and it's a fast casual restaurant where you order at the counter and they bring the food out to your table. I like that they have predetermined meals, like the spaghetti and meatballs that I chose, in addition to a build your own pasta menu. Food was great and tasted of a higher quality than Fazolis, for example. The restaurant is light and bright, with high ceilings and comfortable booths. Great lunch spot and like the yelp check in for free breadsticks! Plus, Mac Shack also offers a 10% military discount!

Loved, Loved, Loved the Gouga Mac& Cheese!!  Better than Mom's, shhhh.
Our server was so nice and attentive, the atmosphere was great. You HAVE to check out the sinks in the bathrooms, creative and cute design!
 Can't wait to go back and try the rest of the mac & cheese creations they offer!

It's been awhile I haven't been to Mac Shack since my last visit at their first location in the southwest at Durango and Warm Springs last year. Overall my impression of their concept of fresh and built your own pasta dish makes this place interesting and allows you to be inventive. Great for families and groups of friends who are particular with vegan and vegetarian items. I usually get the Broccoli Pesto dish and it is really balanced and delicious but I usually ask to lighten the use of oil. 

The have cupcakes from Cupcakery for desserts at this location in case you have a sweet tooth or you can have a free tootsiepop at their entrance upon leaving the restaurant.

The atmosphere is like a cross between Italian chain Fazzoli and Macaroni Grill with a rustic and modern approach. Staff is attentive, friendly and knowledgeable. Will be back soon!
Julio and his team are amazing!!  Great service and great food.  Be sure to grab a box as this is way too much food for one person.
Went here for lunch with some friends place is nice and clean ordered some Mac and cheese was really good we all enjoyed our food. I thought is was a little expensive for what it is though.
Freshest pasta with the best bread sticks. Most helpful workers and very nice. Menus has changed but still the best!

My office occasionally gets delivery from Mac Shark via Post Mates. Being a health conscious person, there are few options to choose from. That alone would not make for a poor rating as every restaurant has it's specialty and I understand that theirs is comfort pasta. I do my best by ordering a salad and soup.

The problem is what I receive for my salad. Slimy wilted mixed greens and brown cucumber are not my idea of something worth paying for no matter what your specialty. I normally don't do a write up about a single negative experience because I know that everywhere has their off days but this was the second time in a row. If you don't sell enough salads to serve them fresh, then take it off your menu. 

Unfortunately, I will be recommending that we no longer order lunches from Mac Shack. I hope they can shape up but they've lost me and my coworkers.
AWESOME!!!!! Food was hot and yummy!!!! the employees are friendly and helpful! Great place to take your family

This is a nice little place for a quick lunch or dinner. The menu is great, and I love how customizable it is! To be very honest, I've only ever tried their mac and cheese. But, I can personally vouch for the truffle mac and buffalo mac and cheese being amazing. The truffle baked mac is my favorite - very delicious flavor, perfectly melted cheese, and crunchy breadcrumbs on top. It is a little pricey, but the portion sizes are ridiculously large (and their pasta makes for great leftovers). The service was friendly and fast, and it's great that they offer you free garlic bread for checking in! They also have a Coke Freestyle machine which is really nice. The restaurant itself is clean with cute decor. This is a great spot for quick, customizable comfort food.

Service needs a lot of improvement. Ordered to go at 7pm, got food at 7:40. Thank goodness we decided to stay and eat because they got our order wrong. No apology given.  Won't be coming back for sure.

Let me preface this review by saying that I HAVE NEVER EATEN HERE.... however... i will tell you about my experience... i walked over from the nail shop next door to check the place out.  The decor is super cute...outside... they've made a plane walkway into a cute dining patio area... I walked inside..the 3 people behind the counter couldn't even be bothered to glance up at us.  The young teen in the dining room who was mopping said a polite hello though....I looked at the menu with my sister and my friend... none of us had been there... no one offered any help with their menu or anything... the menu items sounded great... but like another review... it was just set up like a cafeteria.... so the food is over priced. . . we decided to leave... as i walked outside my friend say their lunch special on a sign... it seemed reasonably priced ... it ended at 5 pm... it was now...no joke 5:03... my friend went inside to see if we could still get the special... NO. not a sorry ...not anything but NO.  . . . so im not about demanding for things as a customer... but i had never been there... i was super interested but the prices were a little out of my comfort zone for just a late lunch/ snack.... but no??! ...so we left... and sorry ... i don't care if ive missed out on the best food on earth..they will never receive my business.

I bought a Groupon that was good for $25 in take out food.  Rather than wait until the Groupon was ready to expire, I used it within a few weeks of buying it.

I had read the concept of this place on Yelp and I studied the menu.  My wife told me what she wanted and I knew also.  Off I was.

Since the Groupon was for $25, I made the two meals manga size which is an extra $2.99 for a larger serving.  For my wife, the pomodoro fresco with angel hair pasta, tomatoes, marinara, and parmesan and Romano cheeses.  For me, Crazy Alfredo which is fettuccini with chicken, Italian sausage, roasted red peppers, shrimp, sun dried tomatoes, mushrooms, and jalapeños.  We also got a side of sweet corn with creamy parmesan sauce.  Since I was already getting a deal with the Groupon, I didn't double dip and use the Yelp check in offer of free garlic bread.  Next time.

The meals were packed in aluminum containers and I was on my way in less than 10 minutes from the time I walked in the door.  Manga size is much too large for us.  We had some one night and the rest the next night as leftovers.  My wife commented, "I really enjoyed that!"  I tried some of her dish and it was good.  My fettuccini was not filled with a lot of the add ins to make it the Crazy Alfredo but there was a fair amount of chicken and sun dried tomatoes.  I could have used more jalapeños--personal preference.  The big disappointment was the corn.  The size of the serving here was just opposite the large main dishes and the creamy parmesan sauce wasn't that exciting.

This is an interesting place to go for a quick pasta fix and I can see myself stopping here now and then when I don't want to cook.  A-OK.

When I first discovered this place a month or two ago, I would have given it 5 stars. I am glad I waited to review since 3 stars is a much more accurate reflection of the food and service they provide. Please keep in mind that this review is for gluten free dishes only which means modifications have to be made to some of the sauces, not just the pasta.

First of all, if you're looking for what you should order, go with the Baked Rigatoni ($8.75). I have had it several times, each time being phenomenal (except yesterday when I ordered to go and was disappointed that there wasn't much sauce). I always get it gluten free (not by choice but by necessity) and they don't charge extra. And it's A LOT of pasta! The gluten free pasta tastes pretty darn close to regular pasta and I have yet to get sick after a meal here which tells me they take food allergies seriously. A++ for that! I have also had the GF versions of the Cheddar Mac ($7.75) and Pomodoro Fresco ($7.75). Cheddar Mac is absolutely delicious and my SO (who is not GF) loves this as well as the Baked Rigatoni just as much as I do. I also enjoy the Pomodoro Fresco and it's a good dish when you want a lighter pasta. Also, I enjoy the very reasonably priced Green Salad ($5.50) with balsamic vinaigrette.

Now for the disappointing ones: Broccoli Pesto ($8.50), and Chicken Alfredo ($8.95). The Broccoli Pesto isn't anything to write home about but what really makes this dish a huge disappointment is the chicken (or lack thereof). The chicken is bland and they literally give you a few pieces for the whole dish. Additionally, I had a really bad experience with the Chicken Alfredo. I only ordered it once and was unhappy that the sauce was so runny that none of it stuck to the noodles. I approached who appeared to be the manager (he dresses differently than the other employees) and explained. Now, I've noticed before that he isn't the friendliest guy (never smiles, but other than that offers competent service) so maybe that's just his natural demeanor but I thought he could have been better in this situation. He explained that because it's gluten free, the sauce is like that. I explained that I understood (even though it's not hard to make a sauce thick without flour) but that I was still unhappy with it. He offered no apologies but he did say he could put more cheese to make it thicker and I said okay. It came back with barely an improvement but I wasn't going to bother him again. What's more, there were only a few pieces of chicken in this dish too. Lesson learned, I will not order this again. Quality doesn't have to be sacrificed to make a dish gluten free. I would have been much happier with an apology and an offering of another dish. I'm hoping this review will be helpful to the business owners and management. This place has the potential to be a 4-5 star joint.

With that said, I will continue to be a repeat customer because of the other dishes I enjoy! The rest of the staff is super friendly and helpful. Service is fast and done with a smile. Much appreciated!

TL;DR
Affordable prices, yummy pasta, and good service. I recommend Baked Rigatoni, Cheddar Mac, or Pomodoro Fresco. Don't order Broccoli Pesto or the GF version of the Chicken Alfredo - both are disappointing and they are stingy with chicken. Salads are good!

I decided to order from here off Postmates because they were offering a special where one order of Mac N Cheese was free just had to pay for delivery.

What a total disappointment.

I honestly felt like Kraft Mac N Cheese would've been better than the watered down crap I got. I ordered the Cheddar Mac and I might as well of just been eating plain noodles.

The only good thing about this place was my Caesar salad, and even that was nothing to write home about.  

I am just really shocked by how bad my food was because they had a lot of positive reviews... I would hope I just caught them on a bad day but I have a feeling they really are this bad all the time just sadly over hyped on Yelp.

Smh.

I am hesitant to call this place a real restaurant as it is semi-fast food/cafeteria like in my opinion.  You go up to the counter where they have pastas lined up in a window and you order and after about  minutes, bam...your pasta arrives at your table.  So, I'm trying to keep this in perspective. I would liken it to Fazolis or something like that.

My wife had the spinach and artichoke mac & cheese while I had the shrimp scampi.  I will say that my wife liked hers but I was totally underwhelmed and since she has the ability to write her own review, this one is on my experience.  I was very disappointed when the pasta showed up with salad shrimp.  There was just a vast gap between what I expected to arrive and those salad shrimp that showed up.  I have never seen them used for shrimp scampi before and I must say, I think there is a huge difference in taste and texture.  Needless to say, my experience was highly disappointing and I don't think I will be back as I feel I could get a lot more value for my money elsewhere.

Mac shack pasta attack!

First time I went in, I  got the impression of a east coast theme as if I was in Boston or New York.

Ordered off the menu a couple of favorites and I was quite please. Crazy Alfredo and bottle service.

Everything was cooked fresh and took around 20mins to take away.

For sure a place I'll  come back to try something else out.

Overall
Price: $$$
Food: 4-5
Service: 4-5
Come back: yes
If you have more tan four you are out pluck siting together if someone has the only table. You can have whole wheat pasta on anything as long as it is penne.

So so yummy!!! We bought a groupon, went in for an early dinner with my mom and son. The young man that greeted us was friendly and nice and had 100% knowledge of the menu and what was vegetarian. Our food came out in great time and was fresh, hot and so so good! The servers/ cashiers came to check on us, which I love! The restaurant was so cute and clean and they had a great selection of music from the 90's to today! We were pretty much the only ones there. Enjoyed our time together and our food! Would definitely recommend and can't wait to go back! Big portion sizes for the price! Well worth it! And don't forget to tip your server/ cashiers!!!

Today I went to Whole Foods and saw "Mac Shack."  My boyfriend loves him some pasta so I decided to get us some carryout for lunch.  The staff was SUPER friendly.  I really felt comfortable going in there for the first time and lingering over what to choose- the girl who took my order was very helpful and patient.  Thankfully there was no line on a Sunday so I didn't have to feel guilty about anyone being around me.  I ordered the artichokes au gratin side dish, a Philly Cheese Steak-inspired pasta for my man, and myself a wedge salad that had prosciutto, dates and some cheese.  I added sirloin on my salad for $1.75!  It wasn't a lot of meat but for $1.75?!  Seemed like a deal to me.  Everything was great when I got home- I hadn't even double-checked my order before I left the place so that was good.  The artichokes were OK but I probably won't get them again.  Next time I may have to get two orders of sirloin or ask if they have a bigger salad.  Sorry I look small but I eat like a horse and the salad just was not big enough.  The menu states they have side salads so I'm wondering what size those are?  Another thing I like about this place is you can order The Cupcakery cupcakes and I looooove Cupcakery!  This seemed like a nice place.  Probably will go again for a Caprese Grilled Cheese!

I was crazy excited to go here. I love, love, love pasta.  You walk in and it's cafeteria style but urban chic.  Nice high ceilings and open layout is welcoming and clean. The girl helping me was nice bc it was my first visit there.  I got the lunch combo with the mushroom soup and build your own pasta with wagon wheels and meat sauce.( yes wagon wheels made me giggle and feel kiddish but they really do hold the sauce well) okay back to the review.  My food, the soup.  It was a weird texture but I love soup and I love mushrooms. It was like they put mushrooms in a food processor and chopped the mushrooms up to little ground grain sized pieces. Like polenta or grits.  Anyway it was tasty because I like mushrooms but weird at the same time. My pasta was a huge let down.  Over cooked. I was eating mush. I felt like a baby or an old lady without teeth that needed get noodles to be mushy and fall apart soft...yucky.  I'm a girl who likes my pasta aldente.  I wanted to complain but I got over it because I was full from the soup and breadstick anyway.  Ended up taking it home and trying to pawn it off on someone else.  

So sad because the mac and cheese combos sound so good but not if my noodles are gonna remind me of paste not pasta.

Good place for large groups because you pay before you get your food, it's casual, people can get what they want and the place had an overall comfortable chill vibe.

This place is very inconsistent. After an experience of overwhelming oil I asked for very light oil. Again I am grossed out and drowning in oil. Having that much oil is not necessary.  My roommate begged me
to come here and I was very hesitant. We now know why. Was hoping spending $10.00 would be worth it. Absolutely not. Would have rather spent it on the $8.00 whole foods meal. Will not be returning. The only reason I am giving them a two is I like the concept.

Fast service. Nice staff.  I got the smokehouse Mac and cheese which has bacon and a hint of BBQ sauce blended in. It was just ok. I received free garlic bread for checking in on yelp. Small bonus. Oh and they have that soda machine where you get to choose from 200+ flavors which I love. The atmosphere is pretty cool. Like others have mentioned it's kid friendly. My child loved the food. They gave her a fruit roll up with her meal. Again small bonus. They also have a cute little lollipop stand near the entrance/exit for kids to grab. I'm not going to lie I grabbed a couple for myself. Overall the place is descent. I will come again just to try out some of their other dishes.

The food is absolutely never a disappointment. Some of the workers, however, are kind of rude and act like you are bothering them or something. Definitely become one of the pasta club members so you can get a free meal!

TLDR: 4 star food, 2 star manager= 3 star

I was really excited to try this place. After living here a year, and being someone who loves mac and cheese, it's insane that I hadn't stopped in for a bowl yet. So Easter Sunday with no other plans? Let's do it! 

My wife and I came in around 7:30, we really like the decor, and the lady at the register was super super nice. Unfortunately, we ordered a couple alcoholic drinks, and she needed to have the manager (guy with very greased back hair) check our IDs. Everything was great, but I noticed afterward that our woodchuck was 5 bucks on the receipt, but very obviously 4 dollars on the menu. 

I went back up because our free garlic bread wasn't on the receipt, she apologized and put it through. Then I asked about the woodchuck. The manager and her both stared at the menu like "huh, so it is 4 dollars" ... And the manager proceeded to turn around and say "well I can't change the price." With attitude. The girl at the register, who was so helpful was also able to understand this was a crappy thing to do to a customer, and offered me one dollar out of the tip jar. I refused (I mean, it wasn't HER fault, I'm not taking tips). 

Anyway, just a ridiculous situation, with obvious evidence (the receipt and the menu) that it was the restaurants fault, and zero effort from a manager to make any sort of amends (not even an apology.)

The food itself was pretty good. The pepper jack mac and cheese my wife ordered was nothing special at all, but my truffle baked mac and was absolutely delicious. I added the steak, which wasn't great. 

Would definitely come back for the food, but I really dislike giving business to places that aren't managed well.

I come here all the time and the food is always amazing but today I walked in to a oven!!! It was so miserably hot that my husband and I just walked out. So embarrassed that I brought my friend here for the first time and it was this bad.
Very pleased with my first mac shack experience. Got gluten free pasta, Alfredo sauce, shrimp, bacon and peas. Had to add a touch of Himalayan pink salt and it was beyond amazing!

Yum!!!! Fantastic food, great service!! Lunch special for 7.99 is a great deal! Your choice of pasta, garlic bread, and a salad or soup! I love the vodka sauce with angel hair pasta! The place is clean and the food is hot and fresh! Great fresh ingredients too! Been here several times now and love it!

This is such a great spot!  The customer service is fantastic and the food is delicious.  You can get the lunch special in the afternoon and they support veterans by offering military discount.
Thank you for giving back to troops Mac Shack! 

Oh yeah, I love their iced green tea as well :)

I stopped here because the idea of customized pasta appealed to me and I haven't been disappointed yet.  My faves are the truffle mac and cheese and I also like to create my own penne with chicken, asparagus and vodka sauce.  It's quick, service is good and people are friendly.  The portion size is large and you are sure to have leftovers for lunch the next day (always a plus).  The only reason that I deducted a star is that the cost is a bit on the pricey side for pasta, especially if you add sides like a side salad or garlic bread.  That being said,  it is a great place to stop for a pasta fix.

I cannot say enough great things about this restaurant!  I always go to the Charleston location and it has quickly become one of my very favorite places to eat. The food is AMAZING (the truffle macaroni and cheese is my number one choice), the staff is pleasant and the prices are more than reasonable!  I have been there more than fifteen times and can honestly say that I have NEVER had a bad meal. I brought a friend of mine there once and she didn't like what she ordered, as it was different from what she thought it was going to be, and the waiter brought her something else to replace it and didn't charge her. Additionally, he did the whole thing with a smile.  Trust me, this restaurant is a definite DO NOT MISS!

I was looking for a Mac n cheese restaurant and this was recommended. Although in summerlin, which I should consider a trek !! Quick order restaurant. Must try!!! So very yummy and good when you are craving that awesome comfort food and just NEED to find a Mac n Cheese restaurant!!

I have to admit I am quite impressed with the Mac Shack. I've seen this place numerous times on shopping trips to the area around Boca Park, but I never stopped in until this past weekend with my husband.

Knowing we were both hungry I knew I had to make a decision that would please both of us. Considering my husband isn't as outlandish with his food choices as myself I decided on Mac Shack. After all, pasta is something we both love.

We arrived during lunch so we took advantage of their lunch special. $7.99 for a make your own bowl of pasta, a choice of a side salad or bowl of soup, a breadstick and a drink. I think that's a really good value, especially considering the amount of food you get.

I got: whole grain wheat penne pasta, with spicy red sauce, chicken, and an extra add in of roasted garlic (I think that cost me an extra 50 cents), and the side garden salad. My husband got angel hair pasta, with Alfredo sauce, chicken, and the corn chowder soup.

The place is very roomy with black/metallic decorations and they play some interesting music over the speakers. As for the food it quickly arrived at our table. My pasta was cooked perfectly, the spicy red sauce had a nice kick with peppers and onions, the chicken was perfectly fine, and a decent amount. Roasted garlic was good, but sooo much I ended up leaving quite a bit of it in my bowl. The salad was decent, and a large portion. You will not leave here unfulfilled. Neither my husband or myself could finish our entire meal.

I would absolutely return... although not too often. I am a pasta fanatic, but I gotta watch those carbs! Good thing this place is not anywhere near where I live or I think I'd be gaining a few extra pounds....
Really love the service Brittney gave us yesterday. Great customer service , awesome food. Definitely one of my favorite places to eat. Even took my cousin from out of state here.

I swear if I could live here - just throw a futon right under the tootsie pops - I would.  Delicious pasta.  Taco mac is divine. Create-your-own-anything is top notch.  They also make your food super fast and deliver - and I swear I'm just in love.

Stopped in here since we were right down the road at Kohl's. So glad that we did! The give amazingly big servings! I had the Mac and cheese with bacon specialty and my friend had the shrimp scampi pasta. They were both really good! We shared a spinach salad which was really good as well! If you check in the yelp you get free bread sticks too! We were not able to finish everything so we took the rest with us!

Went here on the spur of the moment instead of Claim Jumper as it hadn't opened yet.  My grandmother and I both got the lunch special for $7.99.  The pasta and sauce were both delicious, the homemade Italian dressing was yummy, and the breadsticks were awesome!  I had a vegetarian angel hair with garlic and oil, as well as a side of zucchini, and grandma had angel hair with marinara, topped with shrimp.  I typically don't drink soda, but had a field day with the soda machine that pumps out just about anything you can imagine.  Serving sizes were great for the price and everything tasted fresh.  This is probably the cleanest restaurant I've ever been too, and will definitely be returning.

I love that this place is fast, easy and affordable.

I like that they serve Gluten Free pasta.
This is the best restaurant I know for Mac and Cheese! The flavor their dishes have are wonderfully delicious!

Just got here for the vegan options. Lady at the register taking my order doesn't even know what vegan means. They have one veggie pasta and still don't know if it's vegan. Vegans be warned. This is not a vegan place.

I love their website for take-out delivery - super easy to use and lots of options.

The pasta is fantastic, perfectly cooked and the sauces taste fresh and flavorful.  I love the alfredo, vodka sauce, and the macaroni and cheese. I also love that I can add peas to everything I order - that is is my pasta favorite.

Went there for lunch a few days ago.  The atmosphere was kind of hip and rustic at the same time.  I liked the faucet in the bathroom being comprised of nothing but copper piping and ball valves.  As for the meal, my buddy Scott had the Truffle Mac and I had the Pepper Jack Mac.  They were both good and you definitely leave full, but it was a little pricey for what is essentially upgraded Macaroni and Cheese.  I believe we spent about $24.00 collectively for two dishes and two medium drinks.  I won't let this steer me away though because their menu is intriguing to the point where you have to try everything at least once.
Convenient place for quality pasta.  I had a custom order of whole wheat penne pasta, with marinas sauce, shrimp, roasted garlic and tomatoes.  Good weight watchers meal.

I always get the veggie.... it's good stuff... lot of veggies mixed on with the pasta... not overwhelmed by the pasta like some places... I enjoy the garlic in it.  Plus they have that soda machine that let's you pick your mix of soda.   Oh and the food is served in a very good size portion for 9 bucks. Fresh veggies not microwaved. They do put like a breadcrumb on top and it seems to have minced garlic.   This last time I had it they could of cooked the pasta for another 2mins. Still kinda of tough.  I included a picture.

Don't go after 8:30.  Their staff only cares about closing up and ignores anyone still in the restaurant.  Never received garlic bread and had to ask for refund; and they took away the iced tea from the beverage station with 5 - 6 tables still occupied.  May never go back.  Only giving 2 stars because food was good and the cashier re-stocked the Tootsie Pop display.

Can't speak on the ambience or the customer service aspects of this establishment because my first encounter was through Postmates delivery but the meal was very underwhelming. I had a grilled mac and cheese; my boyfriend had the Philly cheesesteak Mac (basically Mac and cheese with beef tips, onions and bell peppers --- any Philadelphian would be offended, honestly). Flavorless and lacking cheese... The irony. The garlic breadsticks were great!
Really great pasta casual selections! Nice atmosphere and super service from the staff. Will be back next time we're in town.
Had the taco mac and cheese. Pretty good, but nothing amazing. Good prices and friendly staff

The service here is great. It was speedy and efficient. Also, the character and ambiance is very trendy interesting. However, I didn't think that the Mac and cheese was all that amazing. For a place that primarily serves Mac and cheese, I would think that there is some type of insanely addictive drug packed in their Mac and cheese. But no, it was not addictive at all. In fact, I'd actually prefer the whole foods Mac and cheese over this place(sorry not sorry). I don't mean to be a bitch, but this place just didn't impress me.

I love this place, and really happy I don't have to drive all the way to the other location anymore. The plethora of ingredients means you can try something different and be creative with flavors and textures. The prices are slightly high, but the quality makes it worth it. I'm bummed out that they don't offer their tomato basil soup at this location, but I'll still be back.

It's amazing how one location can differ so much from another. This location is way better than its sister location on Durango & Warm Springs. 

We ordered the following items:

-truffled Mac & cheese
-grilled Mac & cheese sandwich
-breadsticks (FREE with check in!!!)

The truffled Mac & cheese was delicious. It came out hot & fresh from the oven with the sauce so creamy & the bread crumbs perfectly toasted. The portion is big enough to eat part in the restaurant & take the rest home to enjoy later. I took half home & enjoyed it for lunch the next day - still as delicious.

The grilled Mac & cheese sandwich was very good too. It's 2 thick slices of bread which seems to be grilled with garlic butter & has creamy Mac & cheese in the middle. Carb heaven.

The breadsticks were yummy as well. Anything free tastes good though, right? Lol

The servers were nice. The cashier was pleasant. We'll definitely be going back to this location to check out more of the menu.

Went there for the first time this last Sunday because they advertise, KIDS EAT FREE on Sundays.  I told them This was my first time, and I was there for their promotion.  I ordered mac n cheese for my 10 year old son and a Caesar Salad for myself.  Total was about $13.00 and when I asked about the kids eat free promotion, they said it was only if I ordered an entrée.  Funny, I wasn't told that when I ordered, however, did state upon coming in that is why we were there.  Moving forward, the guy told me that their Caesar salad was the best in town.  Hmmmm..... I think not.  It was all iceberg lettuce, not romaine, and it was drenched in dressing with a few croutons and some parmesan cheese.  Hardly a salad at all.  My son even took a bite and spit it out.  I left almost the entire salad untouched.  Now let's talk about the kids Mac n cheese..... again, he took one bite, made a face and was done.  That was our experience there.  Was expecting so much more.  Very disappointed.

We were unimpressed. Driven by many times. Ran across a Groupon offer and decided to try it out. Heavy cheese and sauces, low on herbs and spices.  Not terrible but with so many good food choices in the area, I find it hard to imagine we'll be back.
What a pleasant surprise!  After living back east we've become a little picky with pasta.  It tasted fresh, it was fast and casual.   We'll definitely be back!

second time I've eaten here and I just don't understand their message.  Ordered soup salad and pasta.  First they brought the hot pasta, then the salad and soup.  Asked why they brought the pasta first and not the salad and soup, and I got a lame answer.  Asked to talk to MGR. and got another lame answer- said the pasta was ready first so they brought  that, also said food is cooked to order but all the pasta is sitting out in the hot trays as u can pick the type of pasta u want as it's already been pre-cooked so that was a lame excuse.  In my world, salad and soup come first, then your main dish...just don't get their concept, especially about the "secret menu"!  And food was just so so this time.  My whole wheat pasta tasted like hard cardboard. Soup and salad was Ok and the meatballs and spaghetti was fair!

The pasta at Mac Shack is very good.  If I were rating the restaurant only on the basis of the food itself, I would give it a 5 out of 5.  I have been three times to MS after discovering it.  I often have lunch at the Jersey Mikes at the corner of Warm Springs and Durango.  I saw Mac Shack but never paid attention:  I thought it was some sort of repair or shop for Mac computers.  Then I noticed the elbow pasta on the sign and realized it was a restaurant.  I had the mac and cheese with truffle oil and it was outstanding.  Also had the baked rigatoni and the pomodoro fresca.  The pasta is always done perfectly -- al dente.  And everything is fresh and good quality.  I also had the side salad.  So the food is outstanding.
The Summerlin location has one of those new cola dispensing machines that has hundreds of combinations.  I hate those machines.  Will stick with the Warm Springs location which has the "old fashioned" dispensers.  I waited in line at the fancy, high tech dispenser while about 5 people in front of me, including kids, took forever to get their soda -- some not knowing how the dispenser worked.  Annoying and these new machines are not worth the fuss.
The Summerlin location had some loud irritating music playing.  I don't remember experiencing that at the Warm Springs location.
The customer relations is where I have a problem.  The first two days that I went to MS was at about 2 p.m. in the afternoon -- within the window of their lunch special.  I didn't notice any signs for the $7.99 lunch special.  I ordered pasta with a side salad and a soda.  Instead of paying $7.99 I paid full price, over $15, not realizing there was a lunch special.  It would have been nice if the order taker had the courtesy to mention that they had a lunch special.  Bad customer relations.  If MS wants to build customer loyalty it would be nice if they had alerted me to the lunch special.
Today I went and placed my order at the Summerlin location.  As I was placing my order I asked the cashier about the pasta rewards plan.  She said that every time you visit you get your card stamped and after ten visits the next meal is free.  I said I wanted to sign up.  She said, sorry, but she could not sign me up because she had already swiped my credit card and the order was put through.  She said the next time I come in to make sure to ask to join BEFORE I place my order.  Not sure there will be a next time.  That is bogus.  Again, great food but very poor customer relations.  They should have the ability to sign up a customer even if they have placed their order. 
So, I would have given MS a 5 out of 5 but for what, in my opinion, is really bad customer relations.  Dining out is more than just the food itself.  It is the atmosphere, the service and the customer relations.  MS has fantastic food.  But customer relations is a 1 out of 5.  Hence my rating of 3.
My not being alerted to the lunch special and my not getting a point for my meal tonight has left me with a bad feeling and I am not as enthusiastic about returning.

It was my first time here, it's a very cute place. Love the atmosphere. The prices are like anywhere else, worth what you get. My bestie and I got our food pretty fast and it was delicious! Haven't had tasty mac n cheese in quite a few years and the garlic bread goes great with it.

Smokehouse Mac ! 

The smokehouse Mac is the only thing I order when I come here ! Tastes amazing and has a smoky flavor . I wish it didn't have bacon but other than that - the sauce they saturate it with tastes Amazing !
Loved this place! Went for lunch and all the food we ordered was amazing and tons left over for dinner that night! Highly recommend this place!

I've been there many times ordering mac & cheese to go.  Yesterday I placed to orders to go with a side of their creamy corn.  The mac & cheese was ordered with ham & bacon.  When I arrived home I saw that the bacon was half cooked and never broken into pieces as is normal. It was also made with almost no cheese at all.  Now about the corn, I was expecting a typical small cup side order but they give you maybe 2 tablespoons at most.  What do they think.
The 2 other times I've been there it was O.K.
Eddie

Just right!  Good portion for the price.  We were all satisfied with our dinner, food was served to the table just as I was returning from the drink station.  Friendly staff, clean place and great music!

Couldn't find any hi-chairs though.  

We will definitely be going back!

My boyfriend and I tried this place for Valentine's Day. It was a perfect date place. The food was so good. He got the chicken Alfredo, and he absolutely loved it. I, on the other hand, ended up ordering something that I didn't really like as much as I liked his. He went up and asked if I could get a different dish, and they were totally sweet about it. I ended up with crazy Alfredo (or something like that), and I loved it! The portions are good, especially since the prices are on the higher end. Like I said, it's good for a date. We probably wouldn't go just to go because we have a lower budget usually.

Watch them make your food-with their bare hands IN the cooked pasta. Saw two employees grabbing handfuls of pasta to prepare. Also was handed our bowls with a large thumb IN the bowl. Three unclean processes tells me there is no training or commitment to being clean.

I really like Mac Shack. You get to either choose from their pre-made pastas, which all sound and look delicious! Or you get to pick what you want! I'm sure it's great for parents with kids who don't like certain foods. I definitely need to go back one of these days during their Wine Down Wednesdays or Sangria Saturdays. The prices look very reasonable for their special days. 

Got the lunch special for $7.99! Included a small make your own bowl pasta, soup or salad (I got salad), breadstick, and a drink! It was a perfect sized lunch! 

The pasta was just the way I ordered it. I got bow-tie noodles. Garlic & oil for my sauce. And added some chicken for $1.95 extra. SO GOOD. The breadstick was delicious as well. It was fluffy and well-seasoned! I got a green salad for my choice of salad. The dressing was Italian vinaigrette- tasty!

We ordered a side of sweet corn ($3.25) and cauliflower gratin ($3.95). They were both so creamy and saucy, which made them DELICIOUS! I would recommend these! 
Service was amazing! Friendly staff and very attentive!

I've been wanting to try this place for a while! I learned from other yelpers that they had a Groupon so I got it yesterday and tried it tonight for dinner. I got the chicken Alfredo I added peas and mushrooms too bad they don't offer pancetta as well. I also got the truffle Mac and cheese it's good and pretty cheap even without a Groupon. I'll definitely be back! They even sell Cupcakery cupcakes for dessert so they had me at that;)

Love this place! Sometimes the taste of the food is a bit off but I love the fact that you can create your own plate. Oh and the free breadsticks offer is actually valid  I've had both locations and this one is a lot better and it's closer to my house.

My granddaughter loves the mac n cheese. The good is good and the atmosphere is cafeteria casual. I great place to get a quick meal that is fresh and yummy. I like the free tootsie roll on the way out.

The few times I've been here, the pasta is awesome. But the service never fails to piss me off.

Let's talk about the good things first. Usually when I come here, I get the pepperjack mac with some extra cheese. Delicious and cooked fast, the chefs here are always speedy in pumping out orders and making the pasta just the way you like.The price is a little high, but the proportions are so large that there is usually enough left for me to take home, that is, if I can get a damn to-go box around this place.

A couple problems with the people that are hired here. 
I'm all for employing younger people, particularly students trying to pay their way through college, but how is it that a place that serves beer/alcohol has not one person over 21 on the schedule? There's been a few times I've come here and either can't order a beer from the fridge I'm staring at or have to wait 20 minutes for them to find the manager. Plan and schedule your employees accordingly.

Last time I was here, swear to holy potato, EIGHT tables were empty and trashed. No one was cleaning up. Luckily the drink machines are self serve, but me and my friend who sat their talking for almost an hour and a half, had not one person come by to take away the dirty dishes or offer us a to-go box. They have done this in the past so I know it's something they are trained to do, and when I got up to go refill my soda, I saw two employees sitting and texting on their cellphones. Maybe they were on break, but no one else was around to clean up the havoc of a mess the place was in.

As good as the pasta is here, the dirty environment and lazy workers makes me worry about the sanitary conditions of the food. Probably won't be visiting here that much anymore.

Solid choice for lunch, although I wasn't too impressed overall.

Came here for the lunch special, only to find out that it is only on the most BASIC of pasta choices and sauces.  For instance, the "Smokehouse Mac" that I wanted to order could NOT be substituted even at a higher cost.  They should allow "premium" choices or add on a couple extra bucks per topping desired.

So because of this, I ordered the Pesto Penne ($7.99 Lunch Special): Comes with Breadstick, choice of Soup/Salad & a Drink. Not bad! Wish the breadstick tasted fresher, and perhaps I should have added something else to the mix...like a meat choice or cheese or something, since it was pretty basic and was lacking depth.

For the soup choice, I went with the Chicken Noodle Soup ($3.95 but included w/ lunch special). Good, but not great...I'd recommend trying one of their other choices. 

And because I came here for the mac in the first place, I ordered a separate Smokehouse Mac ($8.95): Smoked Gouda Cheese & Applewood Smoked Bacon with Barbecue Sauce. This was a HUGE portion, super rich and HEAVY. I am a gouda LOVER, but this was a bit much to eat.

Another small qualm, I called in initially to ask if they had free wifi....I was told yes.  When I arrived, I could not get it to work for my laptop or my phone.  After asking multiple employees, some said they did offer it...some said no.  And nobody was able to help me get it working.

Good luck!

I ordered the fettuccine lunch special for $7.99 came with pasta, choice of side salad, a bread stick and drink great price for the portions. I added chicken and broccoli to my pasta and it was still under $12. I'll definitely be going back to try their Mac and cheese. Good food, good prices, Lucas took my order via phone and was very pleasant which is always a bonus. I'll be 5 star happy when they deliver :)

oh dear ..... mac shack, i really wanted you to be better.... better than you actually are or aspire to be... Next time the silly notion occurs in my house, that person will be clubbed like a baby seal. yo, really - it was just not good. 

suckered in by exhaustion from toiling the mines all week, taken with the twinkle of a groupon, which was actually a fool and a wink, we did the dirty deed and ordered online two pastie dishes and a side of cauliflower gratin, scheduled pick up for a hour later....

what we unpacked...was a sad sad poor excuse of spending money out, for food that is worse than, than....well better than jail, but on par with a hospital cafeteria. 

alfredo sauce was an oily pooled mess in the container, instructions to "pack chicken separate" arrived in the container with the side of pesto sauce. oh, the cauliflower -- great idea, terribly executed. cauliflower was not even cooked one bit, gratin crust was also oily and cheese had separated.  

hopes have been dashed --- and here i sit with an extra groupon taunting me, with glee.

Self proclaimed mac & cheese lover here.  Can't believe I just heard about this place now... and I live down the street *palm to forehead*

After drooling over all the Yelp pics, I hit up the Mac Shack and ordered the Smokehouse mac, shrimp scampi and garlic bread.  

LOVED! the Smokehouse.  So freakin' good with those bacon bits (which were plentiful btw) and, I'm a sweets lover as well, so the cheesy sweet bbq sauce was so money.  

Shrimp scampi was a little sour/acidic.  The first bite was an intense, weird flavor rush.  That sauce was not good... but okay enough for me to eat the pasta and dip the bread stick in.  I liked the mini shrimp.

Garlic bread was alright.  Nothing spectacular.  You can totally go to Albertsons, buy the bread and make it yourself.  It was very soft though.  Not super garlicy.

This place gets my stamp of approval, but how can you call yourself Mac Shack and only have 5 mac & cheese dishes??  I plan to try Asiago mac or Crazy Alfredo next time.

I had such high hopes for this place.  I drove out of my way to the Warm Spring location only to find out they have been closed for a couple of months.  So I drove to the Charleston location.  I am GF and it's difficult to find GF pasta anywhere, so i didn't mind driving.  What I did mind was the terrible food I was served.

First the pasta is made of corn.  All GF people know that this is the cheapest of all choices.  It's spikes blood sugar, it's difficult to cook and it has no nutrition or flavor. What's wrong with Brown Rice???  Anyway, my lunch was awful, it was undercooked because corn is so tough you must over cook it to get it done, I guess they don't know this.  It was starchy and stuck to my teeth.  I had the veggie in garlic and oil with chicken.  My food was swimming in oil (I got indigestion) and just awful.  I tried to eat it as I was starving by adding salt and cheese but to no avail.  I left 90% of it on my plate.
I won't return.  Sadly, I'll have to continue to cook my CF brown rice pasta at home

Mac Shack was a new experience for me.  I had hear through my wife that they offered great pasta dishes at a competitive price.  I thought, why not?  I enjoy pasta and they offer a gluten free option to keep the wife happy.  Wonderful!  When we arrived, we were pleased to find an extensive amount of menu options.  The customer service was very friendly and attentive.  We ordered our food and quickly sat down.  Before to long our food was served and we began to eat.  Wife loved her pasta!  Great!  I honestly did not enjoy the pasta dish I had chosen.  There was nothing "wrong" with it, I just wasn't enjoying the flavor.  I brought it back up front after a few bites.  The customer service was stellar!  They offered a replacement at no charge.  My second choice was really good!  They made my experience great and I will surely return!

Good pasta but a bit expensive. I had the broccoli pesto and the food was good, but they did not skimp on the pesto or the oil. After I finished the bottom of the bowl was still full of oil and pesto. It was good but be aware you may be in for more than you expect! My boyfriend had the baked rigatoni and thought it was pretty good except the sauce was a bit bland-needed more spices. We also had the meatball side and the garlic bread side. The meatballs were pretty generic, okay but not great but I did not like the garlic breadsticks at all. It seemed like it was just dipped in garlic powder and didn't have an authentic taste to it.

Overall I gave it 3 stars because the pasta was good and the chicken and broccoli in my dish was cooked very well. Be aware of the prices though, for 2 pasta dishes and 1 side (the garlic bread was a free offer) and 2 fountain drinks it was $26 so kinda expensive when it is essentially a pasta restaurant with a few extra additions to a dish. 

Worth trying and I really want to come back and try the mac and cheese - if it's called the mac shack it had better be delicious!

Love this place. I've tried a few things off the menu...all pretty awesome. You can add any ingredients into the pasta and they have tons of pasta types to choose from. The lunch special is a great deal. Nice decor and the food is always at the table within just a few minutes of ordering. They make it when you order so it's always really fresh. The penne vodka and sweet corn soup are among my favorites. And it's just never too crowded.

I always drive past this place whenever I'm in the Summerlin area and I finally decided to try it out. The place reminds me of Panera Bread, but a pasta-only version. 

I ordered the Crazy Alfredo because I that's what I saw people rave the most about on Yelp. It was $10 and some change and I thought the portion size was more than enough. It had A LOT in it and I wasn't able to finish the whole bowl. 

My boyfriend did the "create your own pasta" option, which is a starting price of $7.99 but 1.25 for extra add ons. He's a plain Jane so he basically ordered a fettuccine shrimp Alfredo, but he liked it, so whatever lol.

We used the "free order of garlic bread" offer which was an order of 2 garlic breads. They were pretty good. Nothing to rave about but nothing to complain about either.

I'd recommend going during the times they have lunch specials. It's $7.99 for your choice of pasta, garlic bread, and a drink. All in all, really good place to go for a filling, inexpensive lunch.
Good for a wide array of pasta and quick. Portion size is good. I created by own but next time will try one of their own craztions. It's basically a Chipotle for pasta.
Ok. Get the grilled Mac and cheese and a bowl of chicken noodle soup. Heaven.hubby had the farmhouse and loved it!

Be aware when you "build your pasta" the add on chicken for $1.99 consists of a pre-measured 2oz, so if your hungry, this will NOT suffice, however, portions of the famed Crazy Alfredo were huge and tasty. The drinks are bottomless and the service behind the counter...good, waiters...a bit subpar. We recommended this place to friends and the following night at dinner they weren't able to try the Zoodles- because Mac Shack ran out! Please be prepared to feed people what's on the menu or walk 100 yards to Whole Foods and restock....SMH

The barbecue salad is huge. Lots of flavor. I've also gotten the broccoli pesto pasta. The broccoli is ground into a fine pesto so no large pieces of veggie. The simple cheddar Mac and cheese is a great choice, too!

Mac Shack makes creating your own pasta meal a breeze because all you do is pick your pasta, sauce, and toppings. There's so many different options that it really made me think of what I wanted...

I got the chicken pesto fettuccine with mushrooms and broccoli. I also got a side of their cauliflower gratin.

The pasta was more on the al dente side, but I think I prefer that for a pesto dish. The only thing I didn't like about it was the fact that my pasta was sitting in oil. I understand that some pasta dishes can get oily, but this was like a swimming pool of oil at the bottom of my bowl. It's not really appetizing to me if there's oil dripping off of my noodles. Don't get me wrong, it was still good (had very rich pesto flavor) but I think they were really heavy on the oil.

The cauliflower gratin was amazing, though! It was creamy and cheesy at the same time, and the bread crumbs were a little crispy which added even more texture and flavor. It was surprisingly filling, so I guess that this made up for the extremely oily pasta...

I think that Mac Shack is a unique concept. They give you good portions for your pasta at an okay price. I'd definitely suggest it here if you're looking for something heavy for lunch/dinner.

This place is great, the possibilities are endless. Great choices for all. The food taste so good you don't need to add any extra cheese. Great service, and very clean.  Very good selection of ambience music at the perfect volume...

Tried to call ahead today to order food and was told there was no need because the food should be out in five minutes.  It took them eight minutes to tell us that all the steak was frozen for our original order.  They then took the next 15-20 min to redo our order.  Needless to say we did not get to eat since our entire lunch break was used waiting to get the food!
Not only was the food AWSOME! The decor was very cute and creative. This is a new fave of mine. Will be back most definitely!!!!!

Great pasta and great choices! Also, they have one of those fancy self operated soda fountains. I love those :)

Prices can get high when you decide to make your own (my favorite is the classic mac with capers) and they have Cupcakery cupcakes there as dessert. The food is always made to order, and served hot at your table of choice. And when you are done you can help yourself to a Tootsie pop. 

I will say that the cupcakes can be a hit or miss as they are not labeled, and the employees here do not know what they are. Unless you frequent the Cupcakery you have no idea what cupcake is what.  Also the table serve can lack depending on who works there. The last time my friend and I came in nearly every table was full of plates, and the entire time we were there they were not cleared. And they weren't busy, and they had quite a few people working.
Not impressed!  Boring!  I wanna support the owner but I was really let down and bored!  Have not considered trying again cause I was so bored!
I love this place the only pasta I like better is my mom's home cooking :) I definitely recommend this place to all you pasta lovers I know how hard it is to find a quick & good bowl of pasta lol

Stopped in here yesterday and despite my own advice, got the lunch special which left me feeling a bit ripped off at $9.50 for a small salad, breadstick, drink and small bowl of pasta which I had to add broccoli to since it comes with no toppings other than sauce. I really think they should modify their lunch special to include 1-2 toppings. Only kids like plain pasta, right?!

I come here quite frequently and I think I've hit my breaking point. I usually order the crazy Alfredo or make a build your own but in both situations it just isn't very good. This place is always crowded and you can tell in the food because the noodles are cooked al dente. The crazy Alfredo while having a lot of different ingredients just tastes bland. I don't think it's worth the time anymore.

Ahhhh okay. so this place had amazing reviews and I love pasta so I had to check it out but here is my concern. Their garlic 'breadsticks' are lame. And what legit Italian place has lame bread????? None. That is right. So off the bad I was skeptical. 

I ended up having the wheat penne with vodka sauce and added pepper jack cheese. That was actually good. The penne was a bit weird but that could have been because they were wheat. The vodka sauce was really awesome probably the only thing I would want from here again.  

The staff here were all really nice and friendly. They helped us wIth everything across the board even with to go boxes at the end. This isn't a normal restaurant type place it's more of a to go area with additional seating. Think  chipotle style. So looking for a nice dining experience probably should go elsewhere. If you're okay with it then it can be good for a quick easy pasta meal. However I probably won't be back since I thought the food in general want mediocre.

I get why this place has higher reviews than I think it deserves. At the end of the day it's very fast and cheap Italian food and we all have a soft spot for a mound of pasta. And yes this place certainly gives you an overwhelming amount of pasta and that more or less is the problem. Everything is speed cooked and in excess. At the end of the meal you cant help but feel sick by just how much sauce is dumped on these dishes. It's a restaurant that is designed for good mac and cheese and we can't kid ourselves into thinking they are any better than the kid's mac and cheese you can get from outback or any other chain making you kraft straight from the box. I have eaten here far more often than Id care to admit, largely because I used to live right down the street from the one on warm springs (no closed- I wonder why) and I am truly a lazy pos. But the convenience isn't enough anymore and Id rather just make pasta myself...or go to Giada and Carne Vino.
I come here because they offer gluten free pasta. It's sort of like the pizza places that do assembly line, so you can pick a pasta, a sauce, and toppings.

I would give the Mac Shack 5 stars, but alas, they have removed their gnocchi from the menu.  The gnocchi was the absolute best part of the menu and I wish it would make a reappearance.  Perhaps as an entrée instead of a side.  I used to come here with my family at least once per week, but now come very sporadically.  All the food is tasty, the service is absolutely amazing, but nothing will replace the gnocchi.  Mac Shack, if you ever bring it back, perhaps as an entree with Alfredo, mushrooms, sun dried tomatoes, and chicken, please let me know and I will be a regular again.  Until then, see you again in a few months.

So the food is AMAZING but literally every thing else was not good! They forgot about my order and I had to remind the server, three times that I didn't have my food while my friends were already finished with theirs. Also the bathroom was extremely dirty and smelly, almost repulsive for a food place. They also smoked up the whole place and we could barely breathe and had to leave. Lastly they had no ice, or napkins available and I wouldn't say they were extremely busy. The servers all just stood around and joked with each other while there were no ice, no napkins, and customers without food.Overall terrible experience, but that grilled Mac and cheese is REALLLLL!!

This place is so-so at best. Good in a pinch but not a first pick. The califlower was the best dish we had. The second visit still didn't impress, which I was so hoping it would. It's a cute place and I really wanted to love it. But the sauce all taste the same whether you chose white or red...wawawa! Lunch maybe, dinner NO! They need to step it up a notch!

The customer service was very good and ordering ahead online was convenient. The food, however, missed the mark.  

My pasta had what seems to be token amounts of other ingredients.  The taste was also rather bland. 

The salad I ordered was a healthier salad (kudos for that) but it was also unappealing.

My new favorite place to eat in Las Vegas. I ordered the pepper jack Mac with the jalapeños... I am going to have fire out of my butthole later tonight, we are talking 4 alarm, none of this trash can in the kitchen crap either.

Only a couple of things that bothered me. #1 did Vegas corner the market on these soda machines with 90 bazillion flavors? I see them everywhere and there is always a line to get a drink. #2 only 4 jalapeños? I could have handled like 8-10 kind of mixed in the Mac and cheese.

Good place, going to try the BBQ one tomorrow possibly.

Check out their lunch specials. I really enjoy the smokehouse mac & cheese. The prices are about average for what you receive.

The decor in the bathroom is pretty cool. Very retro.

Great vibe here!

If you crave macaroni and cheese then you want to go here.  Unique Mac & cheese combinations or customize. I liked the truffle oil baked one and the smoked Applewood bacon dish.  Nice portions, good prices and decent service.  The place is not gourmet but it has better Mac & cheese than at most restaurants.  Side dishes and salads available.

We ate there about 2 weeks ago. Not even average for the for the Mac n Cheese. Pretty sure they left something out it was very bland nat cheesy at all. I would have preferred something out of the box. There was a line to order and it was not busy. The cashiers were confused and obviously not trained. Most of the tables were dirty. We walked by several tables probably 7 or 8 that nobody had cleared. They stayed that way through almost the whole 45 minutes we were there.

Good place if you are craving some good Mac and Cheese and don't feel like making it yourself.  I guess my favorite is the old stand by or the pepper jack.  Definitely is better if you eat it right there rather than take it out, but still good.

I've passed by this place many times visiting my mum in Rhodes Ranch, and having discovered one near my work I decided to give it a go while meeting up with an old work friend who came in town.  I'm always in search of great mac n cheese, so I figured a place named as such would provide a good example of one.  Well, I'm not quite convinced...

You walk up to the counter to order and then they bring the food out to you.  Great service, everyone pleasant and accomodating.  They have one of those million choices soda machine which I love, so I get the diet ginger ale.  More places need to have diet ginger ale and diet Fanta.  Just sayin'.  I ordered the Smokehouse Mac, since it seemed to offer an inkling of protein.  Should have read the barbecue sauce part, just read the smoked gouda and bacon and was thinking something different than what I actually got.  In fact, I wish they made it just with the smoked gouda and bacon because I think it would have tasted better.  The barbecue sauce flavor sort of killed it, I think.  My buddy ordered a mac sandwich and I don't know that having a mound of macaroni in between bread is my ideal, but that bread looked absolutely amazing!  I might have to try the grilled cheese sandwich next time.

It's a decent mac, nothing spectacular, but at $8.95 it's not a bad deal.  With the drink it came out to under $12 total so it's easy on the pocketbook, especially for dinner.  They also have alcohol, which would have gone well with the food but I was at work..


Table-for-1 Factor:  Having that luxury fast-food concept that's popular these days, it's an ideal place to grab a bite by your lonesome.

3.5 stars rounded down. The food is good, I just think it's a little on the expensive side...it is after all just pasta with a few chunks of ingredient X and a sauce. Pretty good combinations on the menu plus you can create your own if you like. They also do salads - I haven't had a bad one. 

They do a "Lunch special" which isn't really a good deal at all sadly. For $7.99 you get a regular side salad, breadstick, drink, and some pasta. It's a smaller pasta portion and you basically get to choose a pasta type and a sauce... if you want anything more like some meat or veggies you have to pay a lot more per item. So it ends up being as expensive or more than a regular pasta dish. Pretty lame "deal". 

They also do "pasta points" where they will track your purchases and once you get to 10 points you get a free pasta dish. Don't get too excited...only the full price pasta dishes count :(
Amazing food! So glad we stopped in. I don't think I've ever had food this fresh and such amazing quality at such a casual place. Wish they had one in Los Angeles!

Overall a great meal, but we will stick with our neighborhood Durango location. Atmosphere much different. Food was great, like always, but we just didn't get the same comfort and warmth as the other location. We go on Sundays since kids eat free, otherwise it is quite expensive for pasta and soda.

Tasty selection of mac and cheese.  Got the smokehouse mac and the pepper jack mac...the smokehouse was definitely smokey and slightly sweet.  I think I actually liked the pepper jack mac slightly better, just for the savoriness.  All in all, short menu and quality food for what they do have.

I felt very awkward ordering because I took my time looking at the menu, the young lady in front did not greet us, asked us how we were or ask if she could help us... I hesitated and played it safe and ordered the Chicken Alfredo and Grilled Peanut butter and Jelly. The menu was visible and easy to order but there was many things I wanted to try. 

When we went here, it was on a Sunday and there was a family of four and a couple who came shortly after. It was pretty empty, slow and the staff didn't seem too busy. We got our drinks (cool machine where you can almost pick any soft drink), sat down and about 5 minutes later a young man gave us our food. The chicken Alfredo was average had a very creamy sauce. We had chili flakes but no parmesan shaker. The Grilled PB&J i took home and was the best part. 

This place is average, I wouldn't mind coming back to try more of their items though.

I absolutely love the ambiance of this location. Compared to the location on Warm Spring, this is the upscale adult Mac Shack! They have red leather booths and rustic wood tables. 

What I ordered: The veggie gluten free add chicken

My Mom got the lunch special. $7.99 for a basic make your own bowl of pasta (comes with noodles and choice of a sauce - add in topping are extra), a choice of a side salad or bowl of soup (she got a salad) a bread-stick and a drink. 

I would love to give this place five stars but some of the times I come my meals are swimming in olive oil. If they could just be a little bit more consistent and work on reducing the amount of olive oil in the dishes I would be super happy!

Hardly ever disappointed. Pasta is cooked perfectly and sauces are fantastic. Kids meals are cheap and they sell cupcakes! Yum! They also have a very modern soda machine... Pretty sure it can make you anything you've dreamed of!

Pasta is quite good"Service is good . But I didn't like the fact I saw the cook !!! Touch the fettuccine with his Bear hands ..... When I ask why????? Employee response was!!!!! they're going to put it in hot Boiling water to take out any germs. Not sure I think that's was a good Answer ...... Still he was polite about it. And I'm glad he didn't have an attitude.

Om nom nom....who doesn't love some delicious pasta?!?!?! 
Um, my absolute favorite thing here is the gnocchi with bacon alfredo...I know what you're thinking...BACON ALFREDO?!?!?! yes, it is as amazing and artery clogging as it sounds :) Luckily it's a side dish and comes in a small portion so you don't keel over and die. 

Otherwise, this is just like any good ole semi-fast restaurant that serves fresh pasta and salads. 

Also, I love that they're always playing old school Sinatra/RatPack music, and the seating area is spacious and clean. There is supposedly a "pasta club" where if you sign up and order 10 entrees, you get $10 off your next purchase (basically your 11th pasta free...)

First time going here and asked the server what was good and ordered the crazy Alfredo and one more pasta that I forgot what is was.

First of all, as I said it was my exciting first experience here, I expected a little tour of how the restaurant works as I saw the open kitchen. However she just pick two items on the menu that was popular.. so.. I ordered them. As I sat there looking at the walls I discovered that there's a great lunch menu specials with sides... wasn't too happy to see that.

Anyway, decent taste, clean restaurant.  I would go back when I want pasta again.  This place is affordable.

Love this place! Was recommended by son..went for family dinner and had a great time..had the pasta with mushrooms and meat..forget what its called. .garlic bread tasty..good music and great casual but cool vibe..DEFINITELY COMING BACK

Awesome concept! I'm an adult who absolutely loves her some mac and cheese, so a restaurant exclusively catering to this dish is a great idea to me. Stopped by this location after spotting the other location on the other side of town. I ordered the pepperjack mac and cheese and my dining partner went for the barbeque mac and cheese. I wanted the pepperjack one to amazing but it was just okay. It needed more kick and another cheese to thicken up the cheese sauce. Maybe a nice gouda? Anyway, it said it had jalapenos in it too, which is always a plus. But there were only 3 jalapenos!! I think they should slice and dice the jalapenos and include it in the cheese sauce. Mmmmm! I think it's a great idea!! The barbeque mac and cheese was the redeeming factor here. It was yummy and hearty with good toothy-ness. Fantastic. I'll be back to try the blue cheese one because I can't say no to blue cheese. Also, I need to try the garlic sticks. My dining partner ate BOTH of them. Also, they have The Cupcakery cupcakes for dessert!! +1!! Definitely try this place if you love mac & cheese. Until next time!

What a delightful lunch I had at Mac Shack. Great place, wonderful service and friendly staff. The restaurant gives you a hint of how delicious the food is when you walk through the door. The aroma of good food greets you as you enter. Great for business lunches and families!

Yumm! This place never disappoints. The Spinach Artichoke Mac is awesome! My favorite thing on the menu. Well, that and the garlic breadsticks! The staff is always friendly, the location is always clean, and the decor/style is perfect too. I have also used them for catering a large party. Great communication, pick up was on time, utensils& paper goods were provided..& most importantly the portions were more than enough! Everyone loved the baked rigatoni, broccoli pesto, salads, and those amazing breadsticks!

Semi-fast food at a reasonable price. Mac Shack is a good, quick option for lunch or dinner in the Summerlin area. 

They offer lunch specials and even delivery. On the two occasions I have ordered pick up from here, I have stuck with the variations on mac and cheese. 

My favorite, the Asiago and bleu cheese mac and cheese is no long on the menu, so I ordered the buffalo Mac and cheese on my second visit. Both are decent and the portions are enough for two meals, so it's a good option for lunch and dinner.

Visited this establishment with my family this evening. Truly enjoyed the service and food. Angel went above and beyond to ensure we had a memorable visit. I will definitely recommend to my family and friends. Thank you Angel for the great evening!

Amazing! I only had the truffle mac & cheese but it definitely made me want to go back for more and try the other menu items they have. I will have to go back for their lunch special and it is great that they also have it on Saturdays!
